Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: RSIsen
Reviews.Content: This was our second week-long stay at Albergo Santa Chiara. Its location right behind the Pantheon could not be better for us as so many key sites are within walking distance; so much of the "soaking in the ambience" activity (Novana, Via Del Corso, Campo dei Fiori, the Ghetto, Trastavere, Spanish Steps, et al) are accessible; and the hotel itself is a good business class tourist friendly place. Yes, pricey but given its location, understandably so. We will stay again on our next visit. Note that some rooms facing the street can get a lot of street noise (the view may make it worth tolerating some noise) so you may want to have a courtyard room (we've had each).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Archaeologist
Reviews.Content: My family of six (aged 75, 46, 45 x 2, 16 and 14) stayed here as part of an Andante tour. As we were in Rome for the archaeology the location was very good as we were in walking distance of most of the important monuments. On occasions we did use the buses which are numerous a few minutes walk away and cheap at 1 Euro for 75 minutes. (buy your ticket in advance) Taxis are not cheap nor easy to come by in the area of the hotel so be prepared to walk. We were accomodated in 3 adjacent rooms, two were good sized, the third adequate. All were spotlessly clean, with very comfortable beds and sparkling white bed linen. There was a lack of drawers and hanging space was limited in the smaller room. Our rooms faced an inner court and were very quiet, except for the local seagulls who seem to be active 24/7! I find the criticism of breakfast strange: there was, indeed, tinned fruit, but also a variety of fresh fruit as well as cereals, yoghurt and fruit juices. Scrambled and boiled eggs were hot and there was a variety of cold meats and cheese, rolls, bread and croisants. Coffee came from a machine but there was a good selection of decent tea bags. The breakfast room was always busy and a bit claustrophobic but the staff were attentive and kept everything replenished. There is a small bar and sitting area downstairs. The staff were pleasant and plentiful. Because we were on a tour we did not need their services to any great extent but other reviewers obviously found them helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Roma?”
Reviews.Author: yuriNorthernViginia
Reviews.Content: You can sleep in until 0830 and still arrive at the Pantheon when it opens at 0900 and have this wonderful, unique site totally to your self, A few hours later, and for the rest of the day, it will be totally packed and lose much of its charm. The Santa Chiara also is so central that you can walk to almost everything of interest. ( Save taxi fare = smart) We had a great corner room on the 3rd floor with windows on both sides and another big one in the large, nice bathroom. Street noise was not a problem and service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Lynda W
Reviews.Content: We (family of four) stayed at the Santa Chiara the last week of March. From the moment we entered the front doors, we were taken care of. The staff are exceptional (a special mention to Frederica and the young gentleman at the front counter in the evening) and went beyond my expectations on any request, big or small, we had. It is in a great location (our kids are 6 and 8) and we walked everywhere except the train station. The bus stop is around the corner if you need it. Our rooms were spacious, very clean and the linen was of a very high quality. The breakfast was adequate and kept you going until lunch time - what more do you really need?? In summary, next time we visit Rome we will stay at the Santa Chiara.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JJtheScrivener
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at Santa Chiara. In the interim, we've stayed at others. I think S.C. is the best hotel we've found in Rome for location, service, breakfast, and rooms. We got a very good price through their website for our new, large room in the newly renovated area. Lovely, but also enjoyed the large older room we'd stayed in previously. Comfortable, king beds. We will return on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “New rooms and old rooms”
Reviews.Author: EmmaWines
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't be better - behind Pantheon but on a quiet street. There is a new section and an older one which was somewhat under renovation when I was there in Feb. All is clean and neat however. Family owned, so the staff is attentive. The breakfast IS a bit ordinary - canned fruit cocktail, weak coffee, but the value, attractive lobby, and steps from the action make it a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Excellent Breakfast, High Quality Room”
Reviews.Author: Ofer G
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel, near the pantheon is excellent. The breakfast menu is the best we have got in Italy. Rooms are clean and the staff is helpful. Only thing which is miossing is free internet connectivity. Other than that I would definitely go back to this hotel. The sleep quality is good even though there is noise coming from the street,

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family albergo!”
Reviews.Author: 278Sunny2105
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (parents with our 2 teenage daughters) stayed here March 2011. The staff was exceptional (except of course for 2 staff members....). The conceirge helped us months ahead of time (one conceirge was exceptional while the other, a family member of the hotel, couldn't be bothered). The conceirge assured us she could help us get gluten free meals for our daughters with celiac disease. When we arrived she spent a lot of time on the computer helping me find gluten free options throughout Rome. She seemed to really enjoy her job and it was a pleasure seeing her smiling face every morning. We had incredible service from the kitchen staff. At the start of our first breakfast the waiter showed me a drawer with gluten free breakfast options for us (breads, crackers, etc). All were delicious and we wished we could get those brands in the US. The waiters (all men) greeted warmly each morning and brought our daughters hot chocolate shortly after they were seated. These kind, gentlemen started our days off right. Finally the front desk staff was thoughtful and kind. The warmly greeted us each time we picked up our key or dropped it off at night. They often helped us make dinner reservations or give us tips before heading out the front door. Of course, one of the front desk men was the age of our daughters and they were thrilled to see him each day (lots of blushing and shy looks...oh well, that's Roma!). The room was spacious, clean and more than we expected. A few nights did warm up more than we were used to but really not a problem. The location is great for setting out on foot. Also, there is some fun street nightlife a 5 minute walk around the corner to the front of the Pantheon (outdoor cafes, street performers, music). Overall, the staff at this hotel made our trip a wonderful time we will all remember for years! The other reviews said the staff was rude and I have to agree that we did run into 2 individuals who were downright rude & both are family members of the Albergo. It is unfortunate to have these individuals act this way but the other members of the staff thankfully overwhelmed us with their kind and generous manner. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cbbutler13
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for it's location, and it was as advertised. Everything important, except for the Vatican is located within in walking distance. The room was big for Italian standards, and extremely clean. The breakfast was good, even though it started a little later than normal in my opinion. The friendliness of the staff, was hit or miss. The desk clerks were curt and offered no help in any manner, but the support staff was very attentive to our requests and needs. I would have no problem booking this hotel again, and would recommend it to anyone interested in spending a little more to be close to all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and a good standard”
Reviews.Author: silversue
Reviews.Content: Spent a few days here to visit the archaeological sites in Rome. A nice hotel, friendly helpful staff, service excellent, breakfast very good and the rooms clean and comfortable. No idea of price since I was with a group. Only drawback is the position. Coaches have to park couple of hundred yards away and the bus station is about a ten minute walk. Got lost several times trying to find the hotel in the dark although it is close to the Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Good quiet location”
Reviews.Author: maraberto
Reviews.Content: 3 star hotels in Europe can be anything from great to horrible. This one is a good bet if you find the price acceptable. The rooms are clean and pleasant. The location is excellent: not only it is very central, it is quiet! The people working in reception are ok. Here is how I see it: they do not own the place and there is lack of leadership/ example of what good customer service means. In any case, it was not an issue for us as we are very independent travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Aloof service sinks the experience”
Reviews.Author: reillygirl
Reviews.Content: It's a shame that the service at this otherwise good hotel put such a damper on our experience. With the exception of the helpful and friendly housekeeping staff, the front desk and bar/restaurant staff seemed schooled in the mistaken art of arrogance. When I wandered into the restaurant one afternoon, hoping to find a place to get some coffee a young man in his 20s shouted at me in a very threatening tone: The breakfast room is closed! - - rather than a courteous "May I help you?" When I softly asked where I might get a cup of coffee, he dismissively waved his hand at me, saying "Ask the front desk!" When I went to the front desk, I discovered who had modeled such abrupt behavior for the young man. I echo the sentiments of the other reviews that have cited the arrogance of the front desk staff. If you don't mind spending a great deal of money to be treated poorly, by all means stay here. For me, no matter how great the location or comfort of the room, would I subject myself to such rudeness again when there are many other better options in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The wonderful S Chiara”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the S Chiara for a week this month, my sixth visit, in a room which the staff had remembered we liked from our last visit nearly 2 years ago. Yet again the staff were all friendly and helpful, the rooms scruplously clean and the service excellent. On the last night there was the mother and father of a thunderstorm and the electricity cut off to parts of the hotel, yet service continued as far as possible as normal, though with the porter continually travelling round the hotel to open the doors and maintaining his cheerful demeanor. Very many thanks to all at the hotel who helped to make our stay so enjoyable. David Breeze

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Patricia A
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed at this hotel for three nights. We had a triple room which was clean, modern, comfortable and quiet. The beds were much more comfortable than beds we had experienced in other parts of Italy. The bathroom had a large tub/shower combination. Our room overlooked the terrace area and it was so quiet! The air conditioning worked perfectly. We never experienced crowding in the breakfast buffet area. We found the selection of pastries, cereals, juices and fruits as well as eggs, ham, cheese to be more than adequate. The location, a half block from the Pantheon, is centrally located for many sites in Rome. We felt safe walking in the area quite late at night. The hotel staff was very professional and polite. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: LosGatostraveler
Reviews.Content: My daughter had a single and I had a double room for single occupancy .in the renovated section.This arrangement insured enough space and privacy for our week in Rome. The location in the heart of the historic district made it possible to walk almost everywhere. Many wonderful gelaterias and a wide selection of eating establishments were conveniently close. The Albergo was immaculate and well-run, although without any particular atmosphere or charm. Still it was good to escape to its quiet after the bustle and crowds of Rome. My room overlooked the street but was quiet as was my daughter's overlooking a terrace. Be aware that the shower is a tight squeeze. I am 5'8" , 140 pounds and managed. If you are taller or heavier be careful. The bed pillows took some getting used to, like sleeping on marble slabs. Right in keeping with what we saw in the church sarcophagi.You can use Wi-Fi for 10 euro for 24 hours over a 4 day period. In a week we spent 20 euro on Wi-FI. Breakfast before 9am meant competing with crowding at the buffet, but then Rome in October is extremely popular. A personal guide is highly recommended. We had Andrea Pollett (a.pollett@libero.it or AWT@andreapollett.com) for two afternoons, and were glad we did. He took us deep into the past in a scholarly and intriguing manner. Much more engaging than a guide book and a million times better than a group tour. Rome is expensive for dollar tourists but we found Albergo Santa Chiara a good value at 205 for a single and 250 euro for a double room,plus soggiorno tax.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: LeeAnn600
Reviews.Content: Good location, safe hotel, average room, good view, But for the money I was expecting a more lux room. I guest when you're a solo traveler, you get the smallest room. So, don't pay more for less. The air-conditioner blew-out in the middle of the night, and the mini-bar was over-heating, when I mention this, the man a the desk didn't care, or compensate me.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel rating”
Reviews.Author: beckyjack
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was perfect for our Vatican, Pantheon and Plaza Novona walking visits. The staff and service was great, rooms were comfortable and sparking clean and there are many great places to eat and enjoy nearby. The breakfast offered was good and having a lounge, patio and sitting area made visiting with our traveling partners enjoyable. We marveled while enjoying outdoor dining and looking up at the Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Air conditioning not working”
Reviews.Author: gladfin
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel, in a perfectly adequate and clean single room, probably quite recently renovated. An 'internal' room, it was utterly quiet though had no view - in fact looked out onto a brick platform and wall covered with plastic leaves two feet away! This did not bother me in the least but what did was the lack of a working air-conditioning unit in Rome with 32 degrees celsius. I had purposely chosen this hotel for its location and the air-conditioning. There are others in the area I could have chosen. I complained each time (often) I passed reception and was repeatedly told that the technician was working on the problem. Both nights the temperature in my room was 26 degrees, whereas outside it was 18. I did not want to open the window for security reasons. Apart from this the hotel was wonderfully central and the staff, with a possible exception in the reception area, were polite and helpful, if not effusive. The crockery at breakfast had had a dishwasher problem and some of it was a bit gritty, but avoidable. Breakfast itself was quite satisfactory. There were many regular and obviously valued Italian guests. Downstairs in the public areas the air-con worked very well! If the management had made some gesture of goodwill when it came to producing my bill I would not be writing this. Of course they did not. Next time I may go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Recent Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: KT_Travelers
Reviews.Content: GREAT location, very helpful staff, good breakfast... If you are looking for quaint this is not it, but the location could not be better, you are in the center of everything, the Pantheon, Campo dei Fiori, Piazza Navona, etc... The rooms are a little spartan, but very functional...

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again-great location!”
Reviews.Author: Jeanie00
Reviews.Content: Albergo Santa Chiara is in a wonderful location in Rome. It is walking distance to major sites -- only steps away from the Pantheon. It is 5 minutes from Piazza Navona and many restaurants. The hotel is clean, nice size rooms, well priced. It has a nice lobby to sit and have a glass of wine at the end of a long day. Breakfast, which is included, is very nice. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: EEIS
Reviews.Content: Excellent location (can't think of a better one), within walking distance of all the major sights in Rome. The hotel was clean and well managed, Federica (concierge) was extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast was better than all other hotels in Italy as it actually had some salty options (hard boiled eggs, cheese, etc.) in addition to croissants, pastries, etc. There is a renovated wing to the hotel where the rooms have hardwood floors and are more modern, although smaller. Bathrooms in both wings were new and very clean. Wifi service spotty at times and may not work in some rooms. In all we were very pleased and would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MollyC2011
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 1/2 weeks in Italy and the last 5 nights were in Rome. What a great location...steps from the Pantheon, 2 mins walk from Sant Eustachio - best coffee, 4 min walk from best gelato San Crispino. 5 min walk to Piazza Navona. Right behind the Pantheon on a quiet street away from the crowds. Breakfast was good and they'll make you a cappucino if asked:-) Front desk staff a bit brusque but Fredrica was helpful. Being independant travellers we did not need musch assistance, so not an issue. The view of the top of the Pantheon can be seen around the corner - top of stairs at the church on Piazza Minerva, 1 block away. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Well situated”
Reviews.Author: AlbertusMaximus
Reviews.Content: I have been to Italy over thirty times. Have been all over the country, but I have a weakness for Rome, and when in Rome, I stay at the Alberto Santa Chiara, because it is right in the middle of the action. You are within walking distance of the Coloseo, Piazza Navona, its right around the corner from the Pantheon, 20 minute walk to Piazza di Spagna and along the way, you can stop at Trevi Fountain. Its only an eight to 10 euro ride to the Vatican. Campo de Fiore is a short walk away, as is Trastevere and all of the good places. All of the routes along the way to these attractions are well policed and extremely safe. There are plenty of restaurants along all of the routes. The hotel itself is a charming place, clean, and has a fantastic breakfast. Rooms are immaculate, and the front desk is very helpful. It is a family run hotel, and someone from the family is always there. I recommend it highly. Alberto

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: oafaward
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, comfortable and had great AirConditioning...which is very important for Rome in August! We had received some sage advice to stay near the Pantheon, even if it cost a little more, because you would save so much on taxis and by walking. We were right in the heart of everything, as this hotel backs up to the pantheon. Awesome restaurants, gelato, espresso...everything you could ask for was just outside the door. The staff was hugely helpful getting us taxis, dinner reservations, a car to the airport....no hidden fees etc. Because of the heat...you want a place where you can come back frequently during the day. We are a family of 5 that got a double and a triple next door to each other. The triple was huge and had it's own outdoor patio. My only (very minor) issue was that the coffee wasn't hot enough :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Gayle V
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy but good value in an excellent location near Pantheon. Walking distance to most attractions - Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Coloseum, Piazza Navona. The concierge is excellent - her name is Frederica and she speaks superb English - lots of great advice and suggestions. The front desk staff was a bit stiff but otherwise fine - I think they just didn't speak English very well so if you can say a few words in Italian, they loosen up! You must leave your key at the front desk every time you leave the hotel - it is very heavy so you won't want to carry it with you. Near bus stops and check out the hidden church behind the hotel Santa Maria Minerva, it has a very plain exterior, doesn't look like a church but it is beautiful inside. We used a company called Viator.com for all our walking tours - they were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: MidwestGirl22
Reviews.Content: The biggest pro of this hotel was its location. We walked to pretty much everywhere in Rome from here with no problems. It was also very clean and the breakfast was very nice. However, stay away from room 329. It has two windows facing out to the little piazza below where we could hear everything. Also, we could hear our neighbors pretty well, too. Very tiny shower.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: mango-montreal
Reviews.Content: We initially were looking for a hotel with a pool in Rome..forget this, there are none in a convenient location with a reasonable price. So we opted for ideal location where we could go back if August heat was too much to take. Albergo Santa Chiara is just what we were looking for. It is next to the Pantheon and the church of S.Maria sopra Minerva and therefore near everything. We needed 2 rooms , one with 2 single beds, which this hotel was able to provide. It is of course a very old building but the rooms are comfortable and quiet ( still have carpets in rooms) and bathrooms were updated (but the shower head is strangely positionned in the midle of the long wall above the bath so I innondated the bathroom floor a few times...). Breakfast is included. They have a nice selection of cereals, yogurt, croissant, fruits. Also eggs, boncoccini and prosciuto. Like many hotels in Italy, they will make you coffee at your request. Rome is very hot in August (we only had that time to travel) and we appreciated being able to come back when we had enough so to take a shower, change and continue . There are many beatiful chuches near by which reopen around 4:00 or 5:00pm. We arrived in Rome on august 15, a holiday so we were not inconvenienced by the limited traffic zone around the hotel (not activated on holidays and week-ends) but there are a few streets closed for repair in the area and our GPS kept bringing us back to a road we could not take so had to cross the Tiber and reapproach by another angle.We returned our car that day as planned (do not drive in Rome!) and never felt we needed it. We left for the airport by limousine that the hotel called for us (48E, large enough for 4 people and 4 medium size suitcases). The hotel does not have computer for its guests (room for improvement here) (but have Wi fi for a fee), the staff was unable to guide us to an internet cafe, they only knew the one next to the hotel (closed then for holiday). We found a good one at Piazza SanAndrea near P. Navona. Staff at the desk is otherwise helpull although inititally I felt they were a bit cold. We stayed for 5 nights

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again if we get back to Rome”
Reviews.Author: mphibbbs
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel primarily for the location and what an excellent choice. One block from the Pantheon, we could always find our way back to the hotel. The rooms were fairly large, the mattress was unbelievable, the air conditioning was great. The hotel has the tiniest elevators ever so we had some laughs going to the room. The hotel provides a very diverse breakfast bar with fresh tomato, cheese, eggs, cold cuts, fruits, pastries, cereals and cookies. The staff was very polite and helpful. If we return to Rome, this will be our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Albergo Santa Chiara Hotel Rome”
Reviews.Author: venice1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Albergo Santa Chiara Hotel for 2 days at the end of June 2011 and for 3 days in the beginning of July 2011. This hotel has a very good location. The Pantheon is around the corner and we could walk to every site. The hotel is very clean. The rooms are a good size, clean , non- smoking and a big bathroom. We stayed in both the new and old portions of the hotel. The new section has a shower stall no tub. The older portion of the hotel had a tub/shower combo. The staff is friendly and is there to help if needed for reservations or travel. Breakfast was included in our price for two people at 250euros. The hotel is quiet for being in the center of Rome. This hotel is very popular and you need to make reservations far in advance if you want to stay there. I would highly recommend this hotel. We have been to Rome 4 times. Go on their web site at www.albergosantachiara.com. The street address is on Santa Chiara so be careful to find the right hotel because there are numerous hotels with the name of S. Chiara or Santa Chiara in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, Cool and perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: ritan1
Reviews.Content: I would love to get my hands on the blueprints for this place! It has been added to over the years and now has this quirky, rambling charm that makes every room and the hotel overall a gem. The hotel really feels like you're in Rome. I stayed in the newest part of the hotel and my room was bijou, barely enough room to move about. But this is not a location or a hotel to spend time in your room. The hotel has several really lovely public spaces - a nice comfortable lobby with tables, chairs, couches and newspapers., a lovely patio space with tables chairs and umbrellas, surrounded by greenery and a really nice sunny reading room. The breakfast room was similarly comfy and breakfast was both well presented and varied. But, back to my tiny room - It was beautifully organized and efficient, so it didn't seem to matter. The bath was about as big as the room and had plenty of space for all my toiletries. One thing to note, especially if traveling with elders or children. The tub required a step up and there were no grab bars, making for an unsteady landing. Also lacking was free Wifi - they have Wifi, but it costs 10 euros/day! I leave for last one of the best things about this hotel - the location. It is around the corner from the Pantheon, down the block from the Temple Minerva, right near Giolitti's Gelataria. The always fun Piazza Navona is a few blocks north and the Campo de Fiori a few blocks east. You can walk to Trastevere, The Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. The hotel is surrounded by lovely stores - check out the chocolate store on Via Monterone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and Comfortable. We loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: LeeJoane
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect for great restaurants and shopping in little boutiques. It was walking distance to many major tourist attractions, yet is on a quiet side street just behind the Pantheon. We loved this nontraditional hotel -- it had the comforts and conveniences we wanted as American business travelers, with clean, modern decor and amenities. Small and comfortable. The breakfast was outstanding. The front desk help spoke perfect English and were extremely helpful. I think it is a bit pricey, but we did not mind since it had everything you could want without alot of fuss.

Reviews.Title: “Staff anything but friendly”
Reviews.Author: dillonh
Reviews.Content: My family of five recently stayed at the Albergo Santa Chiara which we chose for it's location. The room was fine, but the shower was so small - approximately 2' x 2', that when I dropped the soap, I had to squat to pick it up, because I could not bend over. The staff never greeted us when we entered the hotel and with the exception of one young man behind the desk and the bellman, no one was especially friendly. The breakfast was mediocre. If you can find a hotel for the same price with a good location, stay there. It's nice to see a smiling face when you return from walking all day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - good space for family.”
Reviews.Author: Kate1412
Reviews.Content: This hotel had great location to many key sights and shopping. Great nearby restaurants, too. The room was comfortable for our family. Kids had twin in connecting room. Only one bathroom, which made the 2-shower-a-day routine challenging (but doable) Air conditioning was adequate - remember you are in Europe. Their breakfast had the most options out of the 3 Italian hotels we stayed at. Stayed here 4 nights & would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MDGal66
Reviews.Content: Albergo Santa Chiara is a nice hotel, located in a fabulous location. We walked everywhere in Rome, including the Vatican. Because it is nestled in a quiet location, we were able to get some much-needed rest after our long days of exploring and sight-seeing. Nice room, very nice large bathroom, and good breakfast make this place a true gem in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Location makes you feel a part of Rome”
Reviews.Author: OttawaSenshotelier
Reviews.Content: Honestly we couldn't have imagined of a better location to stay in Rome. Via Vittorio Emmanuelle, Via Del Corso, Parliament, Vatican City, Trastevere, Colleseum, Palantine, all walkable. You step out, turn left and you're at the Temple of Minerva where Gallileo was forced to say the world was flat in the 17th century, another 1 minute you're at the 2000-year old Pantheon, which was the inspiration for St.Peter's cathedral. Went for a nice dinner at Hotel Minerva (try their Mojito) and found lots of other restaurants in the area. The famous Gelateria Giolitti is also not too far away. In terms of the hotel, we just needed a place to crash. Bathroom amenities are basic, room is clean, in-room safe, pay-for-wi-fi only available in lobby, breakfast was surprisingly ok. A "locally-run" hotel with a location that truly made our trip to Rome special.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, very nice room, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: 2011Italy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 1 block from the Pantheon, 20 minutes from Trevi Fountain, 20 minutes from Spanish Steps, and about 25 minutes from Vatican. We walked nearly everywhere from here! Interesting room with vaulted and beamed ceiling. Our room for 4 was a 2-room suite with a curtain between us. Very small shower. Front staff was very helpful advising us how to catch bus to the train station, providing tickets. Also best tip of the trip: change money at the post office!! By FAR the best rate in the country with very low (2.58euro) commission no matter how much you change! Wifi very good; had to pay but it works very well. Nice breakfast in the am.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: JimR61
Reviews.Content: This is a quiet, clean, and comfortable hotel which is located just behind the Pantheon and centrally positioned to allow you to easily walk to the Colosseum and ancent Rome as well as to Vatican City. Rooms are more than adequate and bathrooms are, by European standards, quite nice. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Service was horrible and Personnel was rude.”
Reviews.Author: squirrelgirl62
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the best location for a Rome Experience, but that is it. The service as horrible, the front desk personnel were not nice at all. Italians need to learn from the Americans about service quality. No one smiled, nor was anyone willing to help. The manager was rude. It had nothing to do with the language barrier. The personnel spoke English. They just did not want to be of service to anyone. We were treated as second class citizens. Our air conditioned did not work in the room. They took 24 hours to even look into it. Then they said we could move to another room that was the size of a closet. We had to move everything right then or we would lose getting that room. So we had to delay our tour with our friends to do this. Would not let us stay in the air conditioned room for the night and then move our things in the am. They acted as if it was our fault the a/c did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Our hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Don938
Reviews.Content: We are an American couple who live in the Umbria/Tuscany area. When we go to Rome or take visitors, we always stay here. Over the last ten years, we've tried many other hotels, but this is the right combination of price, location, cleanliness, quietness and includes nice breakfast. We've never had a bad stay here and everyone we've sent here have had good experiences. The rooms are small, but quite adequate. The bathrooms are larger than what we've come to expect in European hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location behind Pantheon!”
Reviews.Author: tscarr11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small, clean and in the perfect location. we walked everywhere but to the Vatican. Tons of restaurants etc., and its right behind the Pantheon which is awesome... Great walking at night from the Pantheon to the Trevi Fountain, pedestrian street is lined with cafes and restaurants etc... I will stay here again and I can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “calm oasis in the midst of rome”
Reviews.Author: deekaye
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly sited for a few days of hanging out by the Pantheon, walking to other major points in central Rome (Colosseum, Piazza Navona, Spanish Steps, etc.), eating, and shopping. It is also an oasis when central Rome gets hot and noisy: small, cool, and quiet. While not cheap, the hotel provides value in its location, free breakfast, wi fi, and large, clean, and attractive room with huge bathroom and comfortable amenties (at least in the newer wing where we were). Only suggestion: The front desk and lobby bar service could be a bit friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place I Would Stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: CasciaGuy
Reviews.Content: What a delightful place to stay. We've been to Rome twice, and stayed a week or ten days both times - all here. It's a delightful setting; great staff; wonderful breakfast and close to everything we want to see and do. To best describe the location: If this hotel had a back door, and the Pantheon had a back door... they'd be facing each other. Perfect! We'll got to Rome again, and we WILL stay here. What more can I say?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great breakfast, nice staff, clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shanson
Reviews.Content: It was our second time in Rome and we wanted a hotel closer to Piazza Navona this time since that was one of our favorite Piazza's. This time we went with our "travel friends" who were visiting Rome/Europe for the first time. They loved this hotel as well, we spent evenings at a wine bar on the Pantheon square and loved how close the hotel was to this area. Staff was helpful with restaurant suggestions. I'm a shopper and there were multiple boutiques near the hotel also. We loved the breakfast. especially the warm Nutella croissants! We would drink wine in the comfortable lobby before going to dinner, relaxing after a day of sightseeing. We all agreed next time we are in Rome we will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: gansonwheels
Reviews.Content: It is always a good sign when the desk staff address you by name and give you your room key without asking! All staff were pleasnt and helpful. Our room was a good size with a reasonable sized bathroom. The room staff all greeted you in the corridors with a nice smile. The breakfast was plentiful - the coffee was from a machine but expressos and cappucinos were available on request. The croissants were excellent. The hotel is within easy walking distance of a large number of historical sites and churches. Santa Maria Sopra Minerva across the square should not be missed. There are plentiful restaurants and pizzarias close by.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: sara_uk_11
Reviews.Content: My jaw dropped when I saw the box like room and horrible back view. No bathtub as specified, just a shower. The room was overheated and impossible to correct despite fiddling with the thermostat. The controls can only be altered via computer at the concierge desk. The noise from the street at night prevented opening the window. A main drain nearby meant a noise like Niagrara Falls every time someone had a shower. I stayed for 4 nights before Easter week and the price was 205 euros per night for single use! I can only imagine everyone else staying was on a cheap deal but I booked several months ago. The hotel is totally devoid of character or comfort which would have been fine were it a budget hotel. Concierge service was distant and rude. I asked to change room and was told the hotel was fully booked. Wi fi was also said to be free but there was a charge in the bedroom. What is it with booking agencies giving inaccurate hotel information? On the other hand the hotel was extremely clean and the breakfast excellent and complimentary (despite being told otherwise by Hotel.com so I nearly missed out). There was a comprehensive array of breakfast foods including parma ham/mozzarella and if you asked the waiter expresso/cappuccino also supplied (though not advertised)

Reviews.Title: “What a deal and a great place!”
Reviews.Author: pixie302009
Reviews.Content: We stayed here which is near the Pantheon. The room was HUGE, clean, a great deal, and a great location. The staff was very nice and helped us with where to eat and how to get around. The highlight of this place is the price in comparison with the room... When we walked into the room our mouths dropped. It was very big and clean and nice! I had paid the same price in Cinqu Terre and had a closet of a room so this was a great way to end our trip. Def would ask that if you are booking in Rome to consider this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: RyeBearss
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel - close to everything. The staff at the front desk can be a bit stuffy but the staff in the breakfast room are wonderful. When we walked in, they brought the latte's and the hot chocolates are the kids which were really amazing. I truly miss their wonderful chocolate croissants!! Ask for a higher floor as there is a bit of nightlife in Rome and you can hear some of the louder folks on the streets. *Rooms are nicely decorated and bathrooms are in great condition - all newly done. Easy walk to everything

Reviews.Title: “Mom & 2 Teenagers, Good Location, Helpful Staff, Triple Room.”
Reviews.Author: ellies2010
Reviews.Content: We recommend this hotel. Our room had a pull out bed, 2 twin/full beds, large closet, good bathroom, fridge, bureau. Good air conditioning! The breakfast room is big, the lobby has a small bar area, an outdoor patio, large sitting area with windows to watch for taxi, and a library/ siting area with good tour books. The staff cool, but helpful. Directly behind the hotel is the Pantheon and plenty of shops. The location is safe and perfect for walking to all the famous fountains and squares.

Reviews.Title: “hospitality & concierge bar none”
Reviews.Author: pattyjohn
Reviews.Content: Albergo Santa Chiara is situated on a quiet street in an absolutely perfect location for walking to most of the major historical sites in Rome. It is on a quiet piazza that boarders the beautiful Santa Maria Sopra Minerva gothic church. It is also a couple of hundred yards from the Pantheon. The very capable concierge, Frederica, was key to our memorable Christmas and New Years stay in Rome. She worked with us before, during, & after our stay to secure reasonable airport transfers, as well as, unique event, tour and dinner reservations. Attention to detail and quality are prioritizes as she continued to inquire about our satisfaction with her recommendations. The reception and breakfast staff provided warm and efficient service as well. We will definitely return to this gem on our next visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: lisalycmh
Reviews.Content: We reserved a quad room, which had two twin beds in one room, a double bed in the other and a marble bathroom in between. The AC worked wonderfully well, it was cool, quiet (for the most part) and the breakfast was wonderful - Loved the apricot filled croissants and the easy cappuccino machine! The best was the location - everything was so easy to get to from here. There was even a tiny bus which stopped right outside to zip us up to the Borgese Gardens. So easy to walk around Rome from here. A little pricey, but worth it. The front desk was so pleasant - they so kindly arranged for our reservations at the Borgese Gallery, and for the taxi back to the airport all without a hitch.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: luv2snowski
Reviews.Content: Our room was absolutely fabulous for our family of 5. We had one of their apartments located on the 4th floor that was quite large. The room had two levels, a state of the art bathroom , sitting area, walk in closet, and a large terrace to sit outside. It is a bit of a maize to get to the room but well worth it. Clean crisp sheets we loved on beds that were a bit hard. The room seemed completely sound proof of any noise. Even with our window open it was very quiet. Breakfast was fabulous with a wide variety of choices. Location, location, location....walk to everything. The Pantheon is literally right behind the hotel. Santa Chiara is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Good Property, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DENNISSG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely. Desk staff not overly friendly, but nice enough. The room we had (no smoking, 4th floor) was a bit difficult to get to. I actually got lost the first day..Room , by Italian standards, was good. Bathroom luxurious, but small. Shower was in a bathtub, and it was extremely high to step into. Amenities were good. Wifi was cheap, but.. only one person could use it at a time. We had to take turns checking emails, using internet. Breakfast was good, but.. the coffee was terrible. Luckily, around the corner was a great coffee place (tho closed on Sundays) The reason we chose this property was its locations, which was FABULOUS. One minute walk to the Pantheon, five min walk to Piazza Novona, a couple fore to get to the Trevi Fountain, a few more to the Spanish Steps. Also very convenient to walk (10 min max) to the Victor Emmanuel Monument , with the Formus and Coliseum a few moments further. We even walked to the Vatican very easily, and to Travestere. In short, never needed public transport during our 4 days there.. Only detriment was extremely loud street noise on weekend nights..due to the centrality of the location near the Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “A haven in the center of the hustle and bustle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: vacation-travel-love
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. We'd booked a reservation at another hotel in Rome that was truly awful and totally lucked out when ASC had a room available at the last minute. As it turned out, the room they had open was a triple. We'd asked for a double, so they gave us the triple at the double room rate, plus the Rick Steves discount! The staff was super friendly, the accommodations were beautiful, the sheets on the bed were silky smooth, the bathroom was huge, and the location can't be beat. They included complimentary breakfast, buffet style, and they had lots of choices so we were both very happy. You're around the corner from the Pantheon and walking distance to a variety of other Rome sights. It's not a cheap hotel, but it's Rome and everything is crazy expensive, and you're getting amazing quality here. Frankly, it's crazy in Rome, and if you're running around trying to pack in as much as you can while you're there, like so many travelers, you need a nice hotel to go back to and relax. This is it. Also, there's DELICIOUS gelato around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: travelinda20
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great experience at the Albergo Santa Chiara. I made all arrangements via e-mail, and it worked out perfectly. A driver was waiting at the airport for us, arranged by the hotel in advance, and in no time were in the beautiful, gleaming, spotless lobby. Our flight arrived earlier than planned, but they were able to get us in our room in short order, and by 10 we were out exploring the area. The Pantheon is literally around the corner. We walked absolutely everywhere during our three days in Rome...not a problem. While busy during the day, at night the area got so much quieter and enjoyable. Candlelit tables magically appear everywhere. We just wandered in the area near our hotel until we found a cafe or restaurant that looked good. We were never disappointed. One night we had wine and a meat/cheese appetizer at an enoteca a few yards from the Pantheon----stunning when lit at night. Another night we passed a narrow alley that had a few tables set. There were about 10 tables total and the food was amazing. The staff was as friendly and helpful as could be. Breakfast was good and plentiful. Not fancy, but they had really good coffee and yummy croissants. Ask for a cappuccino, they are delicious. Loved this hotel and would definitely stay here again. By the way, do NOT miss the Borghese Gallery, it was our favorite experience in Rome. Reservations are required, but easy to make over the phone, takes just a few minutes. We did take a taxi to the gallery, since our reservation was early, but we strolled back through the park and down the Spanish Steps. Wonderful day!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: rndavies
Reviews.Content: The location could not be better. The hotel and staff were very professional and high quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Comfortable Rooms, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: idleworm
Reviews.Content: I love this place the very moment I stepped into the hotel lobby. The staff were friendly and inviting and I was able to check into our room when I was there at 11am (check-in time was 1pm). Location. This hotel is very centrally located at a quiet street, just a few streets behind the Pantheon. Everything was very easily accessible. Piazza Navona is like 5 min walk away. Rooms The rooms were very spacious by Europe standards, in fact one of the most spacious I've seen. As the hotel is located along a quiet street, sleep was peaceful and wonderful. All rooms were accessible via elevator. My room came with a personal electronic safe too. Plug points on the desk were very conveniently located. I've been to some hotels where the plug points are in some ridiculous locations making connecting power a pain but not for this hotel. Breakfast Breakfast was buffet-style and the portion and variety was generous. Internet My only small gripe was with the internet wifi. First of all, you have to pay for it - Euro 10 per day. And there is no connection on the fourth floor. Every time I need access to the internet, I have to bring my laptop to the lobby area. All in all, a very pleasant experience. Definitely a place I would recommend when you're in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Best landing place after arrival in Rome, charming and best continental breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: FoodieGal
Reviews.Content: There is lots to like at this property. Though it does not have it's own restaurant, you are served snacks with your cocktails on the lovely patio, just adjacent from the charming lobby. There are many restaurants within walking distance and the concierge-like service will be a big plus for you. The desk attendants are very nice and speak English as well as Italian and other languages. Very impressive front desk. Rooms had such lovely Italian linens. The bed is hard, as was my bed in other properties I have stayed in tn other parts of Italy. However, the little touches like the shutters opening onto a courtyard and a fancy ice bucket when we requested ice, make this place feel more 5 star than 4. It is luxourious while being small enough that you are able to stop for a chat with the staff. The double room felt roomy, especially for Europe. The bathroom had my favourite bidet, and the bathroom was roomy as well. The location could not have been better, especially if you are a walker- each direction there is something to see. The breakfast was the absolutely best continental ever. I had toasted croque madams (toasted cheese, with the ham) each morning and there was so much more. Enjoy this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location, breakfast”
Reviews.Author: njrafter
Reviews.Content: The Albergo Santa Chiara is conveniently located a block away from the Pantheon, one of my favorite places in Rome. The rooms were clean, modern, and comfortable. Very good value. We could walk everywhere from here, and we did. Just a short walk to the Fontana di Trevi and Piazza Narvona. If you'd rather not walk, the public buses are down the block. The buffet breakfast is very generous. We had our best proscuitto of the trip here. The staff at the front desk weren't that friendly and the restaurant that they recommended just down the block was not good, bad service and so-so food. So plan to find your way around and chose restaurants on your own. I would not let that stop me from staying here though. Clientele was largely American when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: DCInsider
Reviews.Content: Simple rooms, very clean, nice breakfast in the morning- but the LOCATION is fantastic. Friendly staff too- we were a group of 20 and I had a penthouse room with patio overlooking the Pantheon that could fit maybe... 50 people. They helped me with food and wine and every night we had a small party out there admiring the views of Rome. Great hotel. Only place I'd stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: rl_lott
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, with all amenities. They are small, but typical of european hotel rooms. Very helpful staff. Very good morning breakfast included. You can walk to many of the major sites and there is a good selection of restaurants and pubs in the near vicinity. Taxi stand right around the corner if you need to get to train station or don't feel like walking to your next sightseeing adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rooms with Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: oxfordcook
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel in June. The rooms were excellent. Clean, spacious and modern with on the wall LCD tvs. Our room had a veranda which made it nice for wine and snacks in the afternoon. Our AC didnt work when we checked in but the staff made it a priority and fixed it rather quickly. Location was excellent. The Panthenon was a block away, Also Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain a walking distance away. Good restaurants are nearby as was the Piazza Venezia. The staff: Sergio, Luigi, Maurizo, Pirro and others were fantastic, Especially super was Federica who helped us get cabs, assisted us generously with her time. Other staff were excellent, too. Have stayed in Rome several times and this hotel is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kgirlDenver
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our favorite during our extensive tour in Italy. We had a wonderful room on the second floor overlooking the street. The breakfast was fresh and had an excellent variety of food. We were wishing we could eat there all three meals. Service and information was just the best. It is very centrally located. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: marig48
Reviews.Content: Everything about Albergo Santa Chiara exceeded my expectations. My room was spotlessly clean, shiny with new amenities. It had a balcony with 2 chairs, unexpected for a single room. The staff went out of their way to give detailed directions for taking public buses in Rome and to help in other ways. The location was perfect, 1 block from the Pantheon and adjacent to the Piazza Minerva with the delightful statue of the baby elephant holding a small obelisk. The location allowed me to explore the charmingm old streets in this area and enjoy tartufo etc at the Piazza Navona. A nearby restaurant that I especially enjoyed was Maccherone -- excellent rigitone with bacon and delicious grilled steak.

Reviews.Title: “This was the place. Especially for the common traveler.”
Reviews.Author: parisparis5
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful. It just behind the Pantheon next to the Piazza Santa Minerva. The hotel is simple, clean, very pretty....excellent staff. For a three star hotel, this hotel is outstanding. I had a room on the 4th floor. It was simple, clean, comfortable, excellent bed, spacious, had a nice television (flat screen), great bathroom with a shower (no bath biut a nice shower). Bathroom was spacious with a nice sink space and many toiletries. I was quite pleased. The room also had air conditioning and it worked quite well. The buffett breakfast was delightful....meats, cheeses, cereal, fruit, breads....something for everyone inlcuding americans...very nice. On my last day I left quite early and they arranged for coffee for me as the breakfast room was not open yet. This was nice. Staff also suggested that I hire a car instead of a cab to airport...this was much appreciated....very efficient and no extra charges for bags. About the same cost as a cab and a direct route....would suggest this. This hotel takes care of you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service at the Best Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: CookingWithMichele
Reviews.Content: The Albergo Santa Chiara combines everything you'd want in a hotel in Rome. Its central location near the Pantheon allows you to easily walk in any direction - north to the Spanish Steps and the Via Veneto, east to the Trevi Fountain, west to Piazza Navona and the Vatican, and south to the ancient city. It's a 1 minute walk from one of the most charming piazzas, the Piazza della Rotunda near the Pantheon. The hotel has remodeled one side of the hotel into crisp, modern decor, but even if you're stuck in an old room, the location makes it worth it. A great breakfast with a wide selection (including special coffees made to order) is included, and if you're there in warm weather, there is a private small patio off the side where you can sit and have a drink. I brought a group of friends, all with special needs and changing schedules and the hotel was wonderfully accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: abd321
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Albergo Santa Chiara in Rome. Special thanks to staff member Ennio who literally walked 1/2 hour to find us because we could not find the hotel in our rental car. (Do not try to drive to this hotel; unless you are totally experienced with driving in Rome, you will never find it.) The room was small but elegant, extremely quiet, and the staff was wonderful. The location right near the Pantheon is excellent. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndreaBH
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel was the location, just in back of the Pantheon, in a quaint neighborhood full of enticing restaurants and gelaterias. It was easy walking distance to most of the major attractions in Rome, including the Vatican, Colosseum/Forum, Spanish steps & Trevi fountain areas, as well as Piazza Navona and Campo de Fiori. The room itself was small but clean and modern. I had followed advice from other reviewers and asked for a renovated room. Our room was facing Minerva square and there was a bit of noise from down below our room but not bad. I have learned to always travel with earplugs and so it wasn't a problem. If you'd prefer a quiet room I'd suggest that you request it when making a reservation. Very good and plentiful breakfast buffet. English speaking and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “small stall shower, no tub, and broken elevator.”
Reviews.Author: Linda47Michigan
Reviews.Content: We are in our mid-sixties. We were given a room on the 4th floor with no tub and only a shower. The elevator was broken for 3 of the 4 days we were at the hotel, requiring us to go up and down stairs several times a day as we came and went from our hotel into the city. Since we were paying $315.00 per night for a standard double, we didn't think this hotel was worth the cost. There is another side to the hotel where we were told the rooms are better, but this is what they gave us "senior citizens."

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but...”
Reviews.Author: YellowRose56
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights with our two adult sons in a quad room. While the location was great and the quad room we stayed in was very spacious and updated, I agree with other reviewers that the staff is arrogant. The one bright spot was Frederica who was very helpful with general questions. Internet is expensive and they wouldn't even look up the weather in London for us from their computer claiming they didn't have access but we could pay for it. Ridiculous for the type of hotel it is. We left the hotel on a bad note: We decided to use their car service to the airport thinking it would be better than a cab. Wrong. The first driver was upset at having to take us for the rate the hotel quoted us so even after leaving for the airport late and getting several blocks from the hotel, he turned around claiming car trouble, and sped us back to the hotel where we were transferred into a much smaller vehicle. This driver talked on his cell phone for the first part of the trip until a police officer caught him then he dropped us off at the first possible place at the airport which meant we had to walk quite a distance to reach our check-in counter. I have contacted the hotel about this but expect nothing. I would recommend with caution.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sixmolars
Reviews.Content: We will definitely stay here again! My husband and I spent 4 nights in Albergo Santa Chiara and couldn't ask for a better location. Located directly adjacent to the Pantheon it was always easy to find when we came back after a long day of touring Rome. There are public busses 1 block away, a taxi stand 1/2 a block and you can walk to just about everywhere from here. (It was far from the Train station with rolling luggage - 1/2 hour....but it was all down hill and we did it!) The breakfast room was large, never crowded and had plenty to choose from. The coffee and juices were good. The lobby spaces were calming and quiet, with an outdoor patio in good weather. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom spacious and new. The front desk staff and concierge were very patient and helpful in all aspects of our stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Crisp Linens, Clean, Helpful Staff and a good choice.”
Reviews.Author: beachbumsall
Reviews.Content: We just got back and the hotel was everything we expected. Convenient to everything in the tourist zone was the main reason for staying but we also wanted the ambiance of a amily run quality hotel. Breakfast was ok but not exceptional. Room had crisp ironed linens and the bed was just a tad hard. Staff helped us on a couple of tours and car service. Staff was efficient but not overly friendly. They did their job and helped us as needed. Last year we stayed at the Hilton by the airport and had the hassle of riding the hotel shuttle to the tourist zone. This was much easier and I'll do it again. I did think we were quoted 250 a night in dollars and when we checked out that was in Euro's so it ran 400 dollars extra but I put that off to my own stupidity. Just be sure you check for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Small Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bride2BeMe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a solo traveler in 2003. The hotel is small, intimate and clean. It's location right behind the Pantheon is perfect for those who want to be near the main tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, orchids throughout hotel, snooty staff!”
Reviews.Author: Islandfanatic
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel cannot be beat! We had a suite with a lovely balcony! The furnishings in the room could stand to be updated a bit, but we found the accommodations very nice anyway. We stayed on the top floor, so there is slanted ceiling in the bathroom, which has a very narrow tub with a shower head but no curtain. Showering was interesting... I am not tall 5'4"... and had to bend over to use the shower. The staff that we encountered did not wish to be helpful at all. We were told one morning (we asked for a cab to be called to get to the Vatican) that no taxi's were available! After stepping outside for a moment (to discuss the rude attitude of the front desk) my mother went back in and demanded that a taxi be called...2 minutes later a cab arrived! I still cannot figure out what the problem was... we had tipped and been polite! In general, the location was worth the price of the room, we also took full advantage of our balcony both in the morning and evenings! The breakfast was very well appointed as well!

Reviews.Title: “good location/ good wheelchair accessible room”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravelalot
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a good location, wheelchair accessible room was very nice with excellent planning. regular room a little small with small shower. bed and linens nice. we had two rooms for four nights and unfortunately missed the first night thanks to iberia airlines. the hotel charged us full price for both rooms for the missed night. understand that this is their policy and completely legitimate but as they were not full we were hoping for some forgiveness and possibly releasing part of the charge. overall decent basic hotel for 180 euro a night off season in good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for all the sights”
Reviews.Author: pkaye99
Reviews.Content: This elegant hotel right around the corner from the Pantheon is clean, efficiently run, and centrally located. We asked for a room in the renovated section as recommended by tripadvisor reviewers, and were given a room on the outsied overlooking a small piazza. It was a bit noisy and the management allowed us to change to an inside room with no fuss at all. I would recommend asking for an inside room when booking. The rates,while a bit high, are a good vau\lue in Rome. Breakfast is pleasant but not extraordinary except for the cappucino!

Reviews.Title: “What better place then Bella Rome to celebrate a special Birthday”
Reviews.Author: barjofree
Reviews.Content: Wanted to do a Mother, daughter and Grandaughter special trip to Rome for my birthday. Against all odds we flew out of New Jersey after a big snow storm only to arrive in Rome and find they were having their first snow in years as well. We pre- arranged for a triple and double room in new section of this hotel. We were pleasently surprised the hotel is very attractive and spotlessly clean. Some of the staff, while being very efficent were not overly friendly others were . Federica a gal not at front desk made up for them. she was great. You cant ask for a better location. The Wi Fi (with a charge) did not work very well in our rooms. Breckfast was good. What we did not like: When trying to obtain info. for our return trip to airport We were given conflicting answers one was they did not recc. a cab for they start out at a fixed price and then have add ons and were not good if you left anything in them.. They kept reccommending a private service they highly rated . But we were given 3 different prices from 45 -55 Euros.. from the different personel we asked. (had a feeling commissions were a factor here) We were only 3 returning to airport. We contracted our own cab, paid the fixed 40 Euro and it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for exploring Rome! Absolutely close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: NaniSantaF
Reviews.Content: We went on a family trip (couple, plus 3 teenagers) to Rome and, at first, we booked a quad-room with an extra bed, but soon we found out that we needed an extra bathroom. The staff was very attentive and proposed and extra bedroom, right in front of the original one, at a very reasonable surcharge. They were all willing to please us all the time as well as give any piece of information we needed. Breakfast was very nice and had everything we needed. There are many restaurants just around the corner, in the Pantheon area. We could walk to almost every tourist attraction in the city! We had a very pleasant stay at Santa Chiara and I would definitely stay there again!!! I even have recommended it already to many of my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel close to Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: thatsamore68
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a week in September and really enjoyed it. The location is perfect, around the block from the Pantheon and centrally located to other major sights. The hotel is very clean and the lobby area is lovely. We thought the breakfast was very good, with a good selection. Federica was very helpful, answered all our questions, and offered much needed advice. Some have commented that the front desk clerks are cold, or are not fond of Americans, but I feel that is because they are listening closely so they can understand what is being said to them in English. I speak and understand Italian fairly well, but must listen very carefully so I can process what is being said. I think learning a few simple phrases, such as good morning, please and thank you, in the language of the country you are traveling in, is a nice gesture and sure to be appreciated. We highly recommend the Albergo Santa Chiara and hope to return some day.

Reviews.Title: “The very best 3-star hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: dragoer
Reviews.Content: We have just been in Rome for the 4th time during the latest 3 years. We have stayed at 4 different hotels. Albergo Santa Chiara is absolutely the very best and will be our preferred hotel in Rome. Location is perfect - in the very middle of the historic heart of Rome. Within walking distance to all major attractions. The rooms are spacious,and so is the bathroom. Everything is very, very clean - no dirty carpets on the floor (wooden floor), no dirty bedspread. The breakfast buffet is the best we have tried in Rome - lots of choices, eggs, bread, ham, sauges, different kinds of cheese, yoghurt, cerials, marmalade, juice, water, coffee, tea, fresh fruits, etc. It's only in the morning - at breakfast - you realize how many other guests there are in the hotel, during the evenings and nights the hotel is very quiet. You do not hear your neighbours through the walls. The staff is very helpful and service minded. Only thing we missed was the possibility to make a cup of coffee or tea in the room. The price for one night is above average for a 3 star hotel. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: jmw123
Reviews.Content: This medium sized hotel is in a great location near the Pantheon. Very comfortable rooms with nice size bathrooms. Breakfasts were terrific, best we had in four cities in Italy. Concierge was helpful with directions and suggestions of restaurants. Not near the metro, but we could walk almost everywhere including night life spots and Roman Forum area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RuthyNewJersey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in an extremely convenient area, around the corner from the Pantheon, a short distance from Piazza Navona, and the Trevi fountain. The rooms are very comfortable and clean, the staff is not overly friendly, but very efficient. Because there are several buildings that were put together in order to create the hotel, the elevators are a bit funny, some rooms require that you walk up steps to get to them. We will definitely stay there again when we go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in wonderful location with good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: HMLT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location - not only around the corner from the Pantheon, but also very near many shops and restaurants, the Trevi Fountain and Piazza Navona. Our room was quite spacious, and the bathroom was large and very nice. The hotel was so quiet that we thought we were the only people staying there - until we went to breakfast in the morning and saw many other guests there. The breakfast is also nice - plenty of options, and, at least when we booked, it was included in the rate. We hope to stay here again and would highly recommend it. to others.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: eva0128
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an accident stay. I forgot to book an extra night at the hotel we were originally staying in, so we had to find something quick for the night and was recommended to go here. This hotel is beautiful! It is in a great location right behind the Pantheon. The concierge was very accommodating and helped us get situated right away, after a long train ride from Venice to Rome. The hotel room was beautiful, quiet and modern. The beds were very comfortable and the bathrooms were nice and spacious. Breakfast was filled with variety and delicious. We wanted to see if we could stay the remainder of our Rome trip here, but they didn't have another room for us to stay for the next 4 nights, so we ended up going to the hotel we were originally supposed to stay in. If we could've stayed at Albergo Santa Chiara, we definitely would've!

Reviews.Title: “If You Want Beautiful Roma at Your Doorstep . . .”
Reviews.Author: MichiganCookies
Reviews.Content: As others have written, this little gem of a hotel is literally around the corner from the Pantheon. If you've got the energy and enthusiasm you can do a nice walk from the hotel to the Spanish Steps and nearby sophisticated shopping or to siteseeing at the Roman Forum and the Colesseum. Whatever way you wander you will surely travel exciting lanes and avenues - the city is truly 'at your doorstep' from Albergo Santa Chiara. Americans will find the rooms somewhat small (and some of the showers very small!) but everything is shiny clean and there is a nice security to the place. The desk clerks may seem a bit cold only because they have to listen to and process our English, but we found all of the staff to be genuinely helpful and kind. As others have mentioned, a breakfast buffet is included and the price is fair for the area. We stayed three nights and returned after a cruise to stay one more. We can't wait to return again!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Chandolin
Reviews.Content: Albergo Santa Chiara is a lovely hotel, very classy. Its reception desk staff is very professional, its concierge is very helpful. Breakfast is very good. The rooms are clean, well appointed and up-to-date. Its location is excellent -- one can walk all over Rome. There is no noise from adjoining rooms. Our room was on an inner courtyard, so there was no street noise. There’s a newsstand right at the corner of the hotel. We stayed there on our last visit to Rome, in 2007, were delighted to stay there again this year, and will definitely return on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: MLfromVA
Reviews.Content: Recommendations on seeing Rome were very detailed and very helpful. Restaurant recommendations were also good. Being so close to the Pantheon was so great, lots of sites to see within a 10 minute walk and great restaurants and bars to frequent.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: DDFAustin
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was absolutely perfect. It was walking distance from all the sites we wanted to visit and was surrounded by excellent restaurants. It is very a very attractive with a pretty garden and sitting area where we met and had drinks in the afternoon. (The bar was not "open" while we were there.) The rooms are comfortable and very clean. The staff at registration was not the friendliest we've met, but they were helpful and cordial. The concierge was very nice and gave us some great suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: FloridaADK
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 3 nights total, two at the beginning of the trip and one at the end. Our room was small but great bed, great linens, great location. Just behind the Pantheon. Good breakfasts. Very helpful staff. Internet available at a price (3 euro/30 mins, 5 euro/60 mins, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and We Got a Great Rate”
Reviews.Author: newyorkanya
Reviews.Content: Choosing a place to stay in Rome is always problematic for us because we often end up spending a fortune and getting a miniscule room. This time around, we got a very good corporate rate so we didn't mind the fact that our room was very small even though it was one of the larger rooms on the property. (I think they called it a suite or a deluxe or somesuch). We consoled ourself with the brilliant location and the extremely helpful concierge (Federica) who came up with a number of excellent sightseeing suggestions including a nearby Palazzo which is open only on Saturdays and was not crowded. Otherwise nothing important to say: there is a little outdoor seating area where people sit and smoke. The breakfast room is windowless and crowded. There are a couple of notable places to eat nearby: Armando's which has excellent home cooking and the famous San Esutachio cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Mac5Miami_FL
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights from late May to early June and were very pleased with our double and triple rooms. Rooms were clean, bright, comfortable and very quiet. Breakfast did not include a hot meal, but was more than adequate. Front desk was was not overly friendly, but helpful when making dining reservations. Francesca, who booked our rooms, was probably the friendliest and most helpful of all. Location was a few minutes from Pantheon, yet in a secluded area so it was quiet. We walked from the hotel to the train station, Colosseum, Trastevere, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and St. Peters. Rome is a very walkable city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service and room”
Reviews.Author: Charlav
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome for our 25th wedding anniversary trip and the hotel was a fantastic first introduction to Rome. The staff was very helpful before and during our stay. They happily arranged for a driver to pick us up from the hotel and delivery us safely to the front door of the hotel in the area of the Pantheon. They arranged reservations for us all three nights and also gave us excleeent walking directions. The hotel room was very nice with a big bathroom and a balcony over looking Minervia square. It was very hot in Rome the days we were there and the room was very cool and we had complete control over the AC. The hotel had an outside "garden" area for relaxing with a great bottle of wine. The bar staff was very attentive with snacks offered with the wine. Everyone spoke excellent english and was very professional. I loved Rome and this hotel. We would definitely stay here again. The location was perfect and i cannot honestly think of anything they need to change. Love it. Also, the breakfast was very ample and good.

Reviews.Title: “Around the Corner from everything”
Reviews.Author: Carol L. W.
Reviews.Content: Having stayed numerous times near the Spanish Steps, or up on the Veneto, we decided to try a stay near Navona and the Pantheon....this is a very well located hotel; it is not deluxe but decidedly first class; everything is nicely done but not luxurious but the prices are reasonable for Rome; a very convenient place with a taxi stand right by the Pantheon and good bus stops just blocks away; we walked easily over to the Tiber and beyond; staff is quite helpful but not intrusive...if you want advice you get it; had a very nice balcony which we would have enjoyed more had it not been close to 95 degrees most of the time. AC was excellent, thank goodness; so was breakfast buffet

Reviews.Title: “Nice but there are others”
Reviews.Author: bobsuenj
Reviews.Content: This was the second year in a row that my wife and I stayed here and it will be the last. Yes the location is good but as you walk the streets you'll find many more nice hotes in the same area. Having spent nights in Lecce and Sorrento before coming to Rome we found the breakfast to be only fair. Fredrica is helpful but the desk clerks were far from friendly and I'm sure they do not like Americans.

Reviews.Title: “Wow well worth it”
Reviews.Author: Alienx99
Reviews.Content: For $100 a night in Rome I wasn't expecting anything spectacular...so when I arrived it blew me away! Not only was the entrance/lobby very inviting but the room itself was tidy, had a/c and a not a bad view. The bathroom was marble from floor to ceiling..I felt like maybe staying in and taking a bath all day. It's central location lent itself to quick walking excursions through out the city. Being next to the Pantheon was nice too. I am DEFINATELY staying here again when in Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: chil47
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and the staff are very accommodating and honest. I left my American money in the safe when we checked out and upon return to pick up our luggage that we had them store for us, they presented me with my money I had left in the room mistakenly. Needless to say, I was very pleased and impressed with the honesty of the staff. The breakfast is very good and the rooms very quite. Overall, this is a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Rome, lacks service”
Reviews.Author: Kelsey1976
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, about 2 blocks from a bus stop, and very close to a taxi stand. Lots of nice restaurants in the surrounding area. The room was extremely clean, and the bed was very comfortable. Our only complaint was the service. We asked to change to a quieter room, and that was not a problem, they gave us 3 rooms to look at. But when we decided, the porter simply handed us the key and disappeared. We would have tipped him to help us move our suitcases! We were never told when breakfast was, or where it was--but that was pretty easy to figure out. When we would come back to the room in the evening we had the impression that we were bothering the clerk to ask for our room key. They also did not want to call to make dinner reservations for us. Rome is an expensive city, and we paid a good sum to stay at Albergo Santa Chiara during Easter week. We just expected that there would be a bit more service. Also they advertise wi-fi in the rooms, but our room was too far from the lobby, so we had to go down to the lobby to use it.
