There was a bar in the lobby sitting area, but there was never anyone there to offer us drinks, so we went out and bought our own bottle of wine, and opened it up in the lobby and used their glasses. And one more thing, we had to hunt someone down in the breakfast room to ask for coffee. Just not what we were expecting when we paid so much to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: WhatNevada
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the Albergo Santa Chiara. My husband and I stayed for 10 days. Our room was big, king bed and a full bathtub. Federicka was so very helpful, as was the other hotel staff. We did keep our room window open at night, there was some noise, but nothing a little wine could not reslove. It was a perfect location. Walked to almost everything. Took a taxi to the Vatican, Museums and Catacombs. It was steps to the Pantheon and we ate at the best place!! La Sagrestia This family owed pizzeria was upscale, good prices and the best food we found in Rome. Only steps from the hotel. Via del Serminario (road) Next to the Pantheon. We went to other pizzeria's, but nothing came close to this place. The pizza, mussels, chicken and service was perfect....................you must go!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Trvlstrp
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic. From here we could walk anywhere and we did. You are a straight shot to the bus lines for venturing farther afield. Being right behind the Pantheon puts you right in the center of the historic area. Anything and everything is right outside your door. The location also presents a bit of a negative. The noise from the street is unbearable. We were there at the end of March and the weather had turned a bit warm. The hotel still had on the heat and the air conditioning would not work. We were in the annex section and as you wandered your way to that building you could feel the heat increase. I complained several times and was told to open my windows. When I did that the noise was incredible and went on all night long. The Pantheon area must be the gathering place for all of the drunks or something. They hooted and yelled constantly. The horse hoofs from the carriages and the sea gulls drove us nuts. We had to close the windows and we burned up all night. I didn't get a good nights sleep the entire stay. The beds, linens, and towels were really quite nice and of a good quality. Be sure to bring your own hairdryer because the one in the bathroom was a joke. The shower was so tiny that I do not know how a large person could even fit. The toiletries were basic and not of a good quality. You might want to bring your own bath soap and shampoo because I think there was only some kind of bath gel in a tiny bottle. If you plan to use your computer you better stay elsewhere. They only offer WiFi in the lounge area but it never worked. It costs 5euros per hour block of time. I was able to get on one day in a five day stay. Finally, I just had to walk to the internet cafe behind the Sopra Minerva Church where they charge 10 euros per hour. The hotel staff was pleasant but just barely. I asked for directions several times and they gave them to us and recommended some restaurants but they really didn't want to be bothered. This is a pretty self service hotel. The breakfast was plentiful and the hours were very convenient. Nothing overly delicious but plenty to eat. Totally self service... If you have to pay more than 200euros per night I wouldn't stay here. There are many more options that are nicer for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: Navigate440
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and loved it. Room was large, comfortable and clean. Breakfast buffet was good compared to some other hotels we stayed at. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The location was ideal - so close to the Pantheon and walking distance to many attractions. We pre-booked our Vatican tour with Angel Tours and were glad that we did. We were there on a weekend and it's closed for tours on Sunday, so we wanted to ensure that we booked something. For the Colosseum, we joined a tour group on site that happened to be starting 10 minutes after we arrrived. Also worth doing. We walked to the Vatican, the Colosseum, Trevi fountain and shopping areas from the hotel. Most fun was sitting at the Pantheon Bar people-watching everyone in the piazza.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best values in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: LynnDB
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 spent December 19-23 here, and we loved it. We paid the Rick Steves rate of 260 Euro for a 2 bedroom suite, including all taxes and a delicious breakfast. Our suite looked like it had been remodeled recently. Everything looked new. All the beds were comfortable. The large bedroom had a twin and an American-size king bed! The other bedroom had 2 twin beds. The sheets were crisp and white and a dream to sleep on. Large bathroom, shower pressure was great, large white towels, toiletries provided, towel warmer, excellent housekeeping, with friendly and helpful front desk. Our suite also had a small alcove with an extra sink and mirror. This hotel is right behind the Pantheon, in fact, it takes about 30 seconds to walk to the entrance of the Pantheon. The hotel is surrounded by fantastic gelato shops and restaurants. We never had a problem getting a taxi, and everyplace that we did not walk to was a short, cheap taxi ride away. The breakfast buffet includes fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, eggs, juices, coffee, teas and a wide variety of fresh baked breads and croisants. The server also brought us fantastic cappuccino every morning. In fact, the cappuccino was so good, we have just ordered a cappuccino machine as I am going to try to duplicate the cappuccino we had at the Albergo Santa Chiaro Hotel. There is not one thing I would change about this hotel. I expect that this hotel will be near the top of TripAdvisor's hotel list very soon.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: Hillman64
Reviews.Content: Just want to add my few words of praise for the Santa Chiara. We stayed in room 228, which seemed to have been recently renovated. Hardwood floor, flat screen TV on wall, very comfortable beds and we especially liked the soft sheets and thick towels. The included breakfast was as good as everyone says. The buffet is self serve, including pots of coffee, but I saw several people request espresso shots, served by the waitstaff. See pics attached of breakfast buffet. It was always well stocked. I also liked the fact that breakfast is available from 7am to 10:30am, a pretty generous window. WifFi internet access is available, for a fee. You must prepay for the increment of time you choose, price varies from Euro 3 for 30 minutes, better rates for longer times. Note that the time you purchase does not have to be used all at once.Just be sure to log off their service correctly and the clock is stopped. All of the front desk staff seemed to speak English, not sure about the waitstaff. In general we found the Romans on the street quite helpful with directions or random questions etc. Found that people in service positions everywhere spoke some English. We spent 4 nights at the Santa Chiara. The location was perfect for exploring the historic areas of Rome on foot. A taxi cab from anywhere in the city centre back to Da Vinci airport is a flat 40 Euro, but be sure to agree the price with the driver first.. I am not sure if the same fare applies in the opposite direction.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection In Rome”
Reviews.Author: apple41
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a one week winter break for my husband and self. It is very well placed in the block behind the Pantheon. We are both in our 60's and found no problem walking to the Vatican, Spanish Steps, the Colosseum etc. There are many nearby places to eat an evening meal. The area felt very safe with none of the graffitti and 'handbag sellers' found around the Ponte Sisto area. The hotel was very clean, the room modern, fridge large enough to store water bottles some beer and food. Wall-mounted TV, good hair dryer. Digital safe in the wardrobe, very useful. Each day the towels were changed as required and we had clean pillowcases but the sheets were not changed all week. We had a third floor room with a view over the Piazza della Minerva. The breakfast was all you could wish for - fruit, juice, many cereals, yogurts, a selection of meats and cheeses, eggs, spreads, toast, coffee, teas and more. All beautifully set out for self-service, although I do not eat wheat or dairy products I had no problems. (there were even Rice Cakes) The reception area is large with an area off with a bar and settees where you can sit to read the supplied newspapers. The staff were all very efficient and helpful, there was always someone who understood english. Problems? the lift was unusable one evening - the third floor was a long way up after a long day walking around. The room was too hot for our taste - the control had no effect, so we simply opened the window to cool down the temperature, (it was cold outside) The Rain - very heavy at times - fortunately we had good raincoats. Yes the hotel is expensive, but you get what you pay for, I throughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: kamp54
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Santa Chiara twice, in May 1999 and May 2004. In planning my current vacation, it's the first place I am checking in Rome. It is centrally located, behind the Pantheon and has the benefit of offering single rooms. Also, they offered a substantial breakfast buffet in '99 and '04 and I hope that they are still offering it included in the price. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: funtimes7
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location behind the Pantheon! room was clean, neutral decor\ the only negative were the staff at front desk: cold, borderline surly and NOT helpful throughout our 4 night stay. Can walk to all location throughout Rome would highly recommend, apart from the staff's attitude.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great choice”
Reviews.Author: KaliD
Reviews.Content: This trip I was on my own. I had some apprehension at first but I felt very safe and comfortable at this hotel. I found the staff to be responsive and extremely efficient. The breakfast buffet is lovely. The location of the hotel is superb and considering the central location, it is remarkably quiet. I was in a single room on the front with a small terrace. The room was small but bright and very clean - everything I could ask for. The glass door onto the balcony was the room's only source of ventilation and it got a lot of afternoon sun and it quite warm even in October. There is a thermostat and although it activated a fan, it did not seem to put out any cool air. I did not find it enough of a problem to register a complaint but NEXT time I will ask for a room on the other side. I do recommend this hotel. I loved my trip to Rome. I'm so happy I was able to go.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the City”
Reviews.Author: Romeo6
Reviews.Content: This hotel was better than I expected. After reading about it on several different websites, I booked this hotel for my husband and I and our son who is in the Army. 3 adults in one room, and we had plenty of room! There were 3 large closets, 3 tables, a desk, mini bar, etc. The bathroom appeared to be all marble and it was beautiful. It had the best shower of any hotel I have ever been in. We arrived at 9:30 am and our room was ready 45 minutes later. The lobby was large and had several chairs and tables. Everything was very clean and the staff was very professional. The breakfast buffet was great. The only thing missing was bacon and eggs, but you won't find that in Italy. The elevator is very small, but you can always use the nice stairway. We had a swift check-out and they had a cab waiting for us by the time we were done to get us to the train station. The location was great and I would stay here over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic find”
Reviews.Author: CTHistprof
Reviews.Content: We moved here midway through a six day sojourn in Rome, and really liked it. We had been staying at the Hotel Lancelot, about which everyone raves on Tripadvisor. We were disappointed by the tiny and charmless room and the lousy location of the Lancelot. Our first day in Rome we passed by the Santa Chiara on our way to the Piazza Navona for lunch and I was sufficiently charmed by the exterior to step in and inquire about availability. Sure enough, they had a room. We moved there two days later, and were entirely satisfied with our stay. There are not many hotels in the Centro Storico district of Rome, and none has the combination of moderate price and quality that the Santa Chiara has. The hotel sits on a little side square tucked in behind the Pantheon. The interesting thing is that in the one block from the Pantheon to the hotel, the incredible summertime crowds that mob the Pantheon at all hours just dissipate. As a result, the hotel is much quieter and calmer than its location would suggest. The result is a perfect combination of quiet and central location. Piazza Navona is two minutes away, as are the Jesu, the Trevi Fountain, the Palazzo Colonna, and most of the loveliest churches in Rome. The Vatican, the Villa Borghese, the Spanish Steps, and the Forum are all within reasonable walking distance for someone in decent shape. We had read from the reviews here that some folks complained of traffic noise. There is an easy solution to that. Just ask for a room on the interior courtyard. These rooms are incredibly quiet and they are also a bit larger than the exterior rooms, some of which have balconies that cut into the room size. Our room also had the biggest bathroom we have ever seen in a European hotel. I will say that the room furniture was a bit outdated--we were not in the recently updated wing. Still, we were very happy with the room, and indeed we were so close to everything that we spent very little time there. The lobby is very elegant, and the breakfast room is fine, though it could use redecorating--all of the bright chrome gives it an institutional feel. The breakfast was very good, with lots of selection, but not quite as spectacular as at our B&Bs in Venice and Florence. Finally, a word as to the staff. Many folks on Tripadvisor have commented on the unfriendly staff. Most of these comments reveal a longing for American style customer service that favors familiar and informal behavior. My experience of the hotel staff at the Santa Chiara was one of an older European reserve. It isn't uncaring and it isn't unfriendly, it is just old school European. The staff was perfectly correct and helpful when approached politely. In short, this isn't the Holiday Inn Express in Memphis. You are not going to get a smile and a "How Y'all Doin'" when you walk in the door. Deal with it. And while you are at it, try to enjoy it. Europeans are different--it's why we travel. To sum it up, the Santa Chiara is a great hotel at a reasonable price smack in the center of Rome. I don't know of another property that fits those criteria. And believe me I've looked.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: FBtravel
Reviews.Content: Albergo Santa Chiara is a good hotel in a great location. It is literally around the corner from the Pantheon and only a few minutes from Piazza Navona and other great locations such as the Trevi Fountain. The hotel is clean and rooms are OK. The breakfast room is large and the food was very good. Overall this is a good selection. My only complaint is the front desk staff. They completely ignored us when we arrived and at several occasions when I needed assistance, they appeared to be annoyed with my inquiries. Overall not friendly or helpful. There was one lady working at desk over to the side that seemed to be freindly and attentive although it did not appear that this was her main role - she was just stepping in to be helpful. Overall, you probably would not be dissapointed if you stay here, the overall experience would be far better with a friendly and helpful staff in the lobby. If we return to Rome, we will take our chances and try a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in rome”
Reviews.Author: Gigem03
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Albergo Santa Chiara on my third trip to Rome. I will stay there time and time again. Albergo Santa Chiara far exceeded my expectations. Our renovated room was clean, stylish, and had everything we could possibly need to make our trip to Rome enjoyable. The location was one of the things that made the hotel so perfect! It is directly behind the pantheon. Previous reviews made me wonder if we would have problems finding the hotel, but upon arrival in Rome I showed a taxi the address and the hotel name and he knew just where to go. We felt extremely safe walking to the hotel each night. Police are stationed right near the hotel on watch. The hotel staff assisted us in every need. The best restaurant we ate at in Italy was recommended by the staff at Albergo Santa Chiara.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: phoenix1958
Reviews.Content: My family of 2 adults and 2 teenagers stayed at Albergo Santa Chiara for 3 nights the second week in June '08. We paid 290 euros, with the Rick Steve's discount, for a quad which is hard to find in Europe. We had read the good reviews in Rick Steve's book and on Trip Advisor. The location is great because you are about halfway between the Vatican and the Coliseum-about a 20 minute walk to those 2 sites as well as the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. Also, the Pantheon is right around the corner and Piazza Navona, a great square with restaurants, artists, and people watching is 5 minutes away. Our quad room was on the top floor which consisted of riding 2 elevators and 2 flights of stairs to get to the room but not too bad of a hike. The room had a double bed in one room and two singles in the other room. It was very clean and organized. Breakfast consisted of breads, yogurt, fruit, cheese, meats, cereal, juice, coffee, and the best chocolate croissants in Rome. The concierge was very cheerful and helpful. She did set up a taxi to the airport that was at the hotel on time for 50 euros. The front desk was helpful when asked but not the most smiley or cheerful bunch in Rome. I would probably stay at the Albergo Santa Chiara again but would also look for other hotels in the same general vicinity that are less expensive. The location is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly good hotel for sightseeing or short trip in Rome”
Reviews.Author: CJH78
Reviews.Content: The location is the best thing about this hotel, behind the Pantheon and within walking distance of a lot of the tourist attractions in Rome, it is a good choice for a short break or business. The rooms are, as with most properties in European capitals, a little small and there are not a lot of amenities there but if you're looking for a clean and well appointed base I'd recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Loved the Santa Chiara”
Reviews.Author: ProudPapist
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 Nights at the Santa Chiara. Location: excellent. Walking distance to basically everything. though we taxied most mornings from Largo Argentina to get a quick start, we walked back from areas in the afternoon like the Vatican, Lateran, and even Borghese. Though we are two fairly young people and really enjoyed the walks (and gelato) on the way back. Room: Excellent rooms, very clean. Got a big quiet room with a large bath/shower. Very nice. Cleaned promptly every day to a high standard. A/C working well even in may. Small elevator, but never a line for it. Breakfast: Good breakfast buffet. Particularly liked the ample buffalo mozzarella, prosciutto and salami. Also had a nice mixed fruit tart one day. Front Desk/Concierge: The concierge we relayed with was great. Made reservations to the Borghese and Restaurants for us. Even gave us a few recommendations near the hotel which were better than ones we had booked from looking in the guide books. Front desk staff generally friendly and in a good mood. Will definitely be staying here again if i can afford it! Definitely worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Family Run Gem”
Reviews.Author: travelenthusiast070
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Santa Chiara 9 or 10 times since October, 2000. We always enjoy our stay, our spacious, quiet, and comfortable room, the helpful and efficient staff, and the excellent breakfasts (especially the capuccino con double espresso and the rosettas). When I read the last 10 reviews I found misstatements or traveller mistakes that required some response, hence this review. First, if a room is too dimly lit to read, ask for a lamp or another room. Second, if traffic noise is bothersome, switch to an inside room. Rome is noisy like all big cities, though less so around the Santa Chiara after traffic restrictions were imposed a few years ago. Third, the "70s decor" is continually updated. For ultramodern decor, try the new non-smoking wing. Third, the "haughty"staff and front desk where "no one ever smiled, greeted us, or even looked up". Though there are times when front-desk people are frantically busy, we have always received friendly responses to our "buon giorno" and "buona sera" . Other guests seeking a similarly friendly response might try the same greetings. Finally, this is a family operation whose care and foresight are clearly reflected in efficient service, continual refurbishing, and multi-year renovations. Experienced travelers should appreciate this, and note it in their reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel, great location.(Wheelchair user)”
Reviews.Author: BobBridges11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Santa Chiara in April 2008. We are a family of 2 adults and two children ( ages 10 and 15 ). Our younger child is a wheelchair user. We wanted a central hotel and Santa Chiara is in a great position - roughly half way between the Vatican City and the Colosseum. We used this hotel as it had a quadruple room available for our dates; the dates being fairly inflexible for us. Our overall impression is of a smart, clean, well organised hotel. Our room was cleaned every day to a high standard. It was an expensive option for us but we knew the price before we booked and we made our choice - everyones budget is different. Our quad room gave the four of us plenty of room, it was clean, in good condition, comfortable beds, beautiful bathroom (shower no bath). The room looked out over a narrow street and there were all the usual expected street sounds late at night and early in the morning - if you want total peace and quiet you go to the countryside - afterall this hotel is in the middle of a city. Buffet breakfast in the clean,smart breakfast room was excellent - a wide choice of food. Breakfast cereals, rolls, cheese, cold meat, lemon and chocolate cake(!), fruits, yoghurts, hot and cold drinks. Breakfast available until 10:30. A word of caution for wheelchair users. Our quad room was right at the top of the hotel which did involve a tiny lift and two smallish sets of stairs. This was not a real problem for us as we are used to carrying our daughter and wheelchair separately - if you were an adult totally dependent on the chair our quad room would have been out of the question. The staff at the front desk in the hotel were friendly and efficient but did not offer us any extra assistance with the wheelchair, admittedly we did not ask but in an excellent hotel someone would have offered. We did not use them to book any services or restaurants as we prefer to do this ourselves. Smart hotel, great location.

Reviews.Title: “very rude staff, very small first room”
Reviews.Author: mmin
Reviews.Content: I read some good reviews for this hotel. I only read 2 bad ones. I have to wonder if the good ones were staying at the same hotel as we did last week. The staff is very rude. We were in a tiny room for 250e. We complained until they finally gave us a nice room. The location is good, but don't expect any help from the staff whatsoever. I asked for hot water for tea one night and they acted like I had said you could you bring my car to the hotel door. There is a sign in the breakfast room to not take anything like coffee to the rooms. The room was very dimly lit. There isn't a lamp on the desk so impossible to read in the room. My advice is if you go there, take anything and everything you might need because they complain if they have to do anything extra. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A marvellous hotel”
Reviews.Author: DonOberto
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel really could not be better. The hotel itself is well decorated, well managed, comfortable and clean. The staff are helpful. It all comes together to make a memorable stay. The only quibble is that the bedroom walls were a bit spartan. A picture or two would not have gone amiss. However that is not worth bothering about given the rest of the décor and furnishings and when the Pantheon, the Corso and excellent restaurants are all within a stone’s throw.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in very good location”
Reviews.Author: Sandra64
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel three times over the last few years. I think they had some major redecoration of the building, because the last time I was there, everything looked brand new. However I'm not sure that all the rooms have been updated. They have a non-smoking floor (what a nice surprise!). My room was immaculate, with a brand-new bathroon (with window). Dimensions were adequate for a single room. Very comfortable bed (queen size). Extremely quiet. The location is just great: very close to the Pantheon, on a nice area. Reception staff was very nice and helpful. I forgot to mention in my reservation that I would prefer a non-smoking room, but they were very efficient and changed immediately my room, when I asked for. I definitely will go back to Santa Chiara

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: syossetexplorer
Reviews.Content: The Santa Chiara is a charming hotel. The staff is VERY attentive with an excellent Concierge. Rooms are contemporary, large by central Rome standards and reasonably quiet due to new windows. It is centrally located for touring, within walking distance of the Forum, many churches, fountains and plazas. It is an excellent value, even with the weakened US$.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but very noisy room”
Reviews.Author: KELor
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed at the hotel- first was Summer 2005. The room this time was disappointing. The traffic noise was terrible and I didn't sleep 2 of the 4 nights there (even though I was exhausted). We also could hear people in the next room in the middle of the night. Not to be indiscreet, but the noise we heard was not something I wanted my teenager to witness! To be fair, I did not complain, as moving to a new room is an ordeal I did not want to deal with. The room was immaculate and beds were comfortable; however the shower was about 3 feet x 3 feet square and rather difficult to maneuver. Breakfast was good- ask for the cappucino. (You need to find a waiter as they do not seek you out). I agree that the staff is not particularly friendly, but that was our experience the last time as well. I did not use the concierge, as I am familiar with Rome. The location is the reason I came back to the hotel- easy to walk everywhere. Taxi stand is close by at Largo Argentina, and we used taxis to get to the Vatican and Spanish Steps. Compared to my previous experience, the room was not as expected or hoped for. If you book, ask for a quiet room- ours faced a busy alley with noisy cars and cycles much of the night. Be aware that the staff is a bit haughty- not exactly rude, but not particularly welcoming- not like my experience in other hotels in Rome and other parts of Italy. As I said before, stay here for the location and the cleanliness. I would probably stay here again for these reasons, but I might stay at the Del Senato if I could get a comparable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Location Can't Be Beat”
Reviews.Author: JPL48
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Albergo Santa Chaira for five nights the last week of September. After months of research I booked a triple room on the hotel website for my grown daughter, son, and myself. Never having been to Italy, or even Europe, I was surprised to see that the room and interior of the building is as modern as it is. While by no means luxurious, perhaps comperable to a Holiday Inn in the U.S., the room was of a fair size for the three of us. It had excellent closet space and a good size bathroom. Everything was immacuately clean. The breakfast had a varied selection of offerings and the quality was good. There was occasional construction noise coming from the building outside our window but it didn't start before 7:30 or 8:00 and didn't continue on all day every day. We spend little time in our room so it never became a problem. The hotel is on a nice little clobblestone sidestreet that is fairly quiet and yet busy enough to not feel isolated. Just around the corner is the crowded Pantheon and many small shops and cafes as well as an excellent gelateria! You can walk pretty much anywhere. We took a quick cab to the Vatican but easily walked trom the hotel to the Borghese Gallery as well as the Coliseum and Trastavere areas of the city --and this from an overweight, middle-aged woman wearing a plastic boot on her leg because of an ankle injury! With every step and turn of the head there is something fabulous to to see. I read many reviews about the hotel staff being "unfriendly" but had decided it wouldn't really matter if everything else was good. By the time we left however, we came to the realization that for us it did matter. We felt it was very uncomfortable and off-putting to come in and out of the building, walking within 5 feet of the front desk, and no one ever smiled, greeted us, or even looked up. It put just a little damper on the stay. Overall, although the location is outstanding, I probably would not stay again at Albergo Santa Chiara. Knowing what I know now, I would look for another hotel in the general area that might have a friendlier feel. If you're visiting Rome for the first time though, this is probably an excellent place to get a feel for what's out there. Obviously, a split decision.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...not very friendly”
Reviews.Author: LaCasalinga
Reviews.Content: As other posters have reported, the Santa Chiara is in a fabulous location right behind the Pantheon. It is, indeed, very clean. I am giving this hotel an above average score primarily due to its great location. So, if location is important to you....it is a great place. If you are looking for any interaction with the staff...not so great. The front desk staff couldn't be any less friendly. I was staying alone at the property and was never greeted once when I walked in the door. In fact, when the front desk people saw me walking the wrong way to my room when I first arrived, they never even stopped me to point me in the right direction. I am not a high maintenance person, but I do appreciate a polite greeting. The only person who was at all friendly was the kind gentleman in the breakfast room who will make you a lovely cappuccino upon request. The rooms are very clean and air-conditioned. My air-conditioning seemed to bring in cigarette smoke (maybe from a nearby room) through the ventilation system. The decor is very 70's...really needs updating. The TV is so tiny that it was very difficult to see it from the bed a few feet away. It did have a few English channels. The water pressure in the shower was excellent and the bathroom was very clean. The bed was very firm...which I liked. Breakfast was more than adequate. Boiled eggs, meats, cheeses, yogurt, cereal, breads, juices, etc. They will make espresso drinks for you upon request. Breakfast was served until 10:30...somewhat later than other hotels I have stayed at. On a few days, I went out early (7:00) to visit some churches and came back to the hotel at 10:00 for a little cappuccino pick me up. If location is what you are looking for...the Santa Chiara can't be beat. If you are looking for any personal contact with the proprietors, you may want to look at other properties. Likewise, if 70's decor will ruin your trip, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Location-location and then some.”
Reviews.Author: Anna-Roz
Reviews.Content: Clearly, the location of this property in the very heart of the Centro Storico is its prime selling point but there are other issues to consider. This was our second visit to Rome and a repeat stay at the Albergo Santa Chiara. The management had graciously acknowledged our repeat visit and honored our request for room 407 with a terrace. In fact, I believe that rooms 405 and 406 also have terraces overlooking the narrow street below, which could be utilized for having a morning capuccino or an afternoon glass of wine and listening to Rome go by. Unfortunately, we were too busy exploring Rome to take the time and sit on the terrace. Perhaps next time. Otherwise, our room and bathroom were of a comfortable size and sufficient amenities. No frills, no antiques, nothing fancy, just clean, comfortable, air conditioned accommodations. A terrific breakfast is included in the nightly rate, which consists of various cheeses and cold cuts, cereals and yogurt, hard boiled eggs, fresh and canned fruit, breads and sweet rolls, and made to order cappucinno. My all time favorite? A hard roll with mortadella and a cappucinno. Who is going to bother making such a great breakfast at home, so why not indulge? The hotel caters to quite a bit of business people since there are several governmental institutions in the immediate vicinity, and I kind of have a feeling that this is the reason why the front desk staff are rather reserved. These folks do not do big smiles but they are not snobs either and, whatever one might need, will be accomplished in the most professional manner. Case on point, we were not able to reserve a visit to the Borghese Gallery prior to our departure for Italy, since the October reservations were not yet opened. I e-mailed Federica at the Santa Chiara and she assured me that she would keep on trying until she secured reservations for us. And she did. As usual and customary, I would like to recommend Settimio, a terrific restaurant, which is located a short walking distance from the Santa Chiara at Via delle Colonnelle, 14; local phone number: [--]. I would recommend making reservations; however, keep in mind that Settimio is closed on Sundays and Mondays. Settimio is patronized by the residents, tourists, and business people, and serves great food at reasonable prices. Antipasto Settimio is a plate full of Italian delicacies; first course of pasta with fresh porcini mushrooms (during fall months) is not to be missed, and roast lamb will melt in one's mouth. I recommend a sgroppino for dessert. In addition to great food, head waiter Georgio is a sweetheart. How about a great espresso or monakera (coffee, chocolate, and whipped cream)? Then one must stop at Cafe St. Eustachio located in the Piazza of the same name, again, right around the Pantheon and the Santa Chiara. One can down the small coffee while standing at the bar, but I would splurge and for a few extra Euro add people watching to the coffee drinking.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, A/C, new bathrooms, a little 1970's though”
Reviews.Author: redsox_flyers
Reviews.Content: Stayed end of August, and enjoyed the hotel. Staff was accomendating, lobby was very nice and well kept, and complimentary breakfast was nice. As for the room, it was a little 1970's, but the bathroom was redone recently, so it was very nice and clean. The A/C was brilliant, seeing it was very hot out, and was essential for daily breaks. They seem to be doing alot of rennovations while we were there, so I'm assuming they are working on updating the rooms. I'd stay here again, mainly because the location was absolutely amazing (right behind the patheon), and the hotel was nice and very clean. We stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: joang
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Santa Chiara for 4 nights in August. It is a basic hotel and the staff is professional and curteous. We stayed in a junior suite that was quite large. It had a large bathroom with a tub and shower and a very large balcony. It was clean and the maid service was very good. The breakfast was average, but the location was superb! It was a good value for hotel in Rome and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreRed
Reviews.Content: Did a lot of research before finally chosing the Santa Chiara and I feel I definitely made the right choice. It seems that hotels are expensive in Rome but Santa Chiara offers a lot for a reasonable price. Of course the location is best. RIght in the middle of everything. But what with all the narrow winding streets it is hard to get your bearings. It is very close to the Pantheon but it took us 2 days to find that out because we happened to go right out from the entrance instead of going left! It is situated in a relatively quiet area within walking distance of just about everything. The air conditioning is also extremely quiet, rooms very clean and breakfast above average for Italy. We found 2 really good restaurants that I can definitely reccommend. A la Rampa t the right of the Spansih Steps and Ristorante Clemente just a short walk from the hotel, past the Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “quiet..and yes we are talking Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: Vintagebabe
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend in Rome. I was booked at this hotel by a third party as I was on business, What are the pluses- a fabulous location- literally a block from the Pantheon. It is on a very quiet street- hence NO noise. My room had a balcony with a small table to sit outside. The room was small with a single bed but very clean. I had a shower but no bath. The staff was proficient but nothing beyond. Would I return? Absolutely!! I love beeing in an area that is so close to everything. I can over look a slightly dated decor and size given the location. The AC was a real plus given the temperature 95F.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: terec
Reviews.Content: Albergo Santa Chiara is a great hotel and the best part is the location, right behind the Parthenon. Almost all the sites are at walking distance, breakfast was good, the rooms were clean and had a good size, we had a triple room. We stayed in June and the a/c worked fine we had a mini split unit and our room had a terrace. I would stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Plain Vanilla”
Reviews.Author: SI-Traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Albergo Santa Chiara for 5 nights in May 2007. The hotel was recommended to us by my cousin, who has stayed there many times over the past 17 years. She was with us, and noticed a great change in the hospitality of the staff. We stayed at 6 different hotels during our visit to Italy, and Santa Chiara certainly had the most aloof staff. They barely picked their heads up when we approached the desk in the lobby. This was a sharp contrast to the warm welcomes we received at the other hotels, where after a day or two the staff knew us by name and room number. We thought the rooms were bare bones. Adequate, and clean, but no extras. One night we had to call the front desk for toilet paper! I was also disappointed in the selection of English speaking television channels. The other hotels we stayed in spoiled us with availability of American television, and we were able to relax and unwind with some TV after a long day of touring. We thought that breakfast was OK, but not great. The cappuccino was kept a secret, and the American coffee at the buffet was awful. We didn't crack the secret code for cappuccino until the day before we left... once we did - it was delicious. (You had to seek out a waiter, and specifically request cappuccino). If all you require is a bed and a shower, then this is the place for you. I can't imagine a better location - we never used public transportation or cabs - we were able to walk everywhere, which is terrific. We didn't have a horrible stay... but plan on seeking out a different hotel for our next trip to Rome. My cousin also said that she will no longer recommend this hotel. I'd rather pay a little more, and have a more comfortable stay in a welcoming environment.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sak01
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in a great location....right near the Pantheon and an easy walk to the Piazza Navona..not far from the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Staff is helpful....rooms are quite nice and clean...air conditioning and shower are good(very important in the summer!!) Breakfast is good and the typical European type(yogurt,rolls,cold cereal cheese). Paid about 270 euros for a triple....Rome is not cheap!!

Reviews.Title: “Rick Steve's Recommendation is Right On”
Reviews.Author: AHW
Reviews.Content: So many hotel choices in Rome and so expensive. Where to start? Rick Steve's Guidebook suggested several hotels which Trip Advisor helped us narrow to the Santa Chiara. Great choice! It's location could not be better. The Pantheon is 100 yards away. Piazza Navona 500 yards. We walked to all the major sights easily from the hotel and a cab ride to the Vatican is short (10 Euros) too. Staff is friendly and don't miss asking the concierge about restaurant suggestions. We had a great meal at Armando's. Room was surprisingly roomy with a queen size bed and adequate wardrobe space. Bathroom of decent size with a tiny shower. Very clean with good linens. Breakfast buffet is included which had both hot and cold choices. One last thing: the hotel will provide a private car upon request to pick you up or take you to the airport (50 Euros). Since there was a taxi strike the day of our departure this saved the day.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: AdamEngland
Reviews.Content: Many on trip advisor will tell you the location was perfect, but near Termini or stuck on one edge of the centre really isn't. In the heart of Centro Storico really is the ONLY place to be. And the Albergo Santa Chiara is exactly that. We got off the bus from termini at Torre Argentina and walked up the beautiful cobbled narrow street to the hotel, stopping for a panini and it was simply perfectly placed in the Piazza Miverna, right behind the Pantheon. I have been to Rome before, so I have the benefit of knowing the best location to position myself. The hotel itself was a good 3 star, and as for the comments about moody reception staff, well we did not encounter that at all, we spooke to 4 different receptionists in our 3 day visit and all were all poilte and helpful. The breakfast is superb, I defy anybody not to find something they like, ask for the cappuccino its great. I stayed last time in the Caesar residence Romane, rated 4th in Rome. This is better. It is a good comfortbale 3 star hotel with a great breakfast in the romatic centre of the Centro Storic. If you want to stay indoors all day, other hotels will surpass. If you want a clean comfortable base with a great breakfast in the ivy clad heart of the centro storico in the absolutley BEST location in Rome. I promise you you will not beat this hotel. Spend 4 times as much on the Minerva next door and you will be dissapointed. Spend 1/4 of the Minerva on the Santa Chiara and you will be delighted.

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of Old Rome”
Reviews.Author: jlshan
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderfully well located hotel,next to the Pantheon and between Trevi Fountain and Piazza Navona. It has good access to bus routes from Piazza Argentina, just a couple of blocks away.The concierge is most helpful in arranging transport to or from the airport as well as booking restaurant reservations. The rooms are well appointed, spacious and comfortable. The hotel is a good value for a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Rome”
Reviews.Author: JohnC2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is family run. It is located behind the PANTHEON in the CORE of Historic Rome. The staff were very helpful at all times. It lies minutes away from the best attactions in Rome. It was recommended to me by a friend and I will be staying there again next visit. The hotel is clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: EminMaine
Reviews.Content: Our family of five just had an excellent experience staying at the Albergo Santa Chiara. The location is truly unbeatable. The Piazza della Rotonda is particularly beautiful at night, and we enjoyed strolling out for dinner and gelato in the evenings. Our quadruple room with an extra bed was a perfect option for a family. Although they called it a quadruple, it was really more like a suite, with separate nooks for the beds so we didn't feel as though we were tripping over each other in one room. Everything was impeccably clean, and the lobby is lovely and gracious. My only complaint is that they failed to give us a requested wakeup call on the morning of our departure, which could have made us miss our flight. Fortunately I woke up on my own!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJtheScrivener
Reviews.Content: Perfect Location for exploring Ancient Rome - Pantheon. Lovely large room and bathroom. Excellent and immediate service when needed. Concierge very helpful. Felt cozy and cared for. Ample, diverse breakfast saved much time in the morning. Stayed for 6 nights - We shall return!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: whammer14
Reviews.Content: Very nice 3 star Hotel in great location. Stayed in apartment #1 which had a lovely garden patio that would be great in warmer weather. Frederica, concierge was most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Molto Bene”
Reviews.Author: studiojr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Santa Chiara for 6 nights last April when I was in Rome on business. Location was ideal - Near everything but somehow more authentic than other larger hotels. My (tiny) room faced the alley and felt removed from the tourist scene. Not a slick nor a luxurious property, but feels organic to what a home away from home in Rome should be. I did not pay for my room, but I believe it was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “dig this location!”
Reviews.Author: chgoclaire
Reviews.Content: I pulled this hotel from a Rick Steve's book on Rome....I reserved it with an email and a phone call from Florence just a few days before arrival. My room was comfortable - great king bed, large marble bathroom with an enclosed shower big enough to move around in (not that common in Italy :) Plenty of hot water, air conditioning, and satellite TV with several English channels and nice radio stations. I had french doors to a private terrace. The breakfast room is bright and there were plenty of choices to give you a good start on the day. The lobby and public areas are nicely decorated and there is a bar and patio in nice weather. The big news on this hotel is the location...just behind the Pantheon and five minutes walk from Piazza Navona, seven minutes to Campo di Fiori, and 15 minutes to Trevi Fountain....and so forth. Everything was an easy walk...there is a cab stand nearby and an electric tram stop. I walked everywhere. There are numerous restaurants and cafes in the surrounding blocks and the whole area is charming....really the heart of Rome. You won't be sorry. The hotel was cheaper than others in Rome, but still expensive with the exchange rate to dollars. I would recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Shey07
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great ! It has a fantastic location the rooms are very clean. The Pantheon is just round the block. The Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona, collaseum are all within walking distance. The Vatican is a bus ride away. The only thing i would say is that the rooms are not very well decorated and the rooms are a bit dark. However the matresses are clean and the bathroom was very nice. I stayed in a single room with a queen bed and if you want to save on a bit of cash and your a couple this would be more than comfortable (room 10). Access from Ciampino is easy the Terravision bus take you to Termini and from Termini you can get the number 60 bus to Argentina. ... The hotel is central to everything would definitely recommend you stay there! Suheda (London)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: 26West
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal - walk to everything. Lots of close restaurants and piazzas to enjoy in the evening. The rooms were clean, modern, quiet and large. My only negative on the hotel is the cordial formality of the front desk. It was our first stop in Italy and we expected a little more "warm and fuzzy" and our conclusion, after 3 weeks in the country, was still the same: This hotel staff was the least friendly of any hotel staff we encountered. The consierge was helpful, however, but didn't give any additional information other than the specific question asked. Unlike a lot of hotels, this hotel did not have internet access in the lobby for guests to use. The internet cafe was close by, however, so it was only a slight inconvenience to check email. Would I stay there again? Most probably.

Reviews.Title: “Classy place with great location”
Reviews.Author: Much2Learn
Reviews.Content: The Albergo Santa Chiara backs up to the Pantheon, making it a perfect central point for seeing the sights of Rome. The electric bus (#116) goes between the hotel and the Borghese Palace area and other public transportation makes the Vatican easily accessible; we easily walked to every other major attraction from the Santa Chiara. The hotel's layout is a bit strange - we had to take two elevators with a long corridor between them to reach our room. We faced a very quiet courtyard, though, and we never heard a bit of street noise, even when we fully opened our large windows. The lobby area is attractive and somewhat formal (dark wood, marble, nice upholstered furniture). There seemed to be many Italian business people mixed in among tourists from all over the world. Breakfast is good; the usual selections of coffee, tea, juice, cereal, pastries and fruit were supplemented by delicious buffalo mozzarella and other fresh cheeses, pancetta, parma ham and other sliced meats, plus tomatoes and olives. The front desk was very efficient and helpful and their English was perfect. There is also a wonderful concierge. Our room was modern, comfortable and larger than many big-city hotel rooms. The bathroom was all marble and glass and seemed fresh and new. There was a safe, a mini-bar and a TV, but the clock radio that had been built into the bedside table was out of commission. The price was very reasonable. This was good, solid hotel and we'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....First Class”
Reviews.Author: JerseyJoe
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this wonderful hotel. The first time was in 1998. It is directly behind the Pantheon. The rooms are super, the bath rooms wonderful. 20" flatscreen TV's and comfortable beds. Extremely clean and a helpful staff. Walking distance to everything. Breakfasts are 7 - 10:30, there is plenty eat (no eggs, but everything else). Beautiful lobby and it is evident that the staff takes pride in their job. The property is spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Great Concierge”
Reviews.Author: HandK
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located for the first time visitors as we were, the hotel is situated immediately behind the Pantheon and adjacent to the Piazza Minerva. More of a businessman's hotel, the rooms we found were very clean with all the conveniences. If you're considering a luxury hotel, this is not it...try the Hotel Minerva around the corner which has a more expansive lobby and reportedly great rooftop dining. However, what promps this review is the fantastic concierge at the Santa Chiara, Frederica. We read about the hotel from Karen Brown's travel book (a great resource) and followed up a correspondence via email with questions and requests. Frederica was prompt, knowledgable, fluent in English and throughout our correspondence and stay at the hotel was just great. An added thank you to the private car and driver she provided to us for a day trip to Pompei. Marco Tavola is with (--) Book him! He was a great conversationalist, licensed tour guide for Rome and best of all for a hot summer's day traveled in an air conditioned Mercedes car. I think he has since purchased a luxury Mercedes van. Again... book him.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: OPY
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, had very nice corner room with beatiful windows to the Piazza. Breakfast is very good indeed, much better than going to a cafe so be sure to book it. Staff is typically Roman - very upnose (especially to Americans - we Europeans are treated a little better ;-) ). Actually asked for rate directly in the hotel and got 130€ after some bargaining (220€ at start) - of course we were lucky because the hotel was not full. Nothing more to say - great choice. Oh by the way - exploring Rome by bike was "our" good idea. Beware the Bikes at the internet cafe round the corner though, you will break your kneck. It is fun, you quickly get to all sight seeing locations and it is fun. Don't worry about the traffic - Romans drive like hell but they respect bikers (at least some of them).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location at Good Price”
Reviews.Author: jfd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night precruise Aug 2006. Hotel arranged car to pick us up at the airport. Driver was waiting for us outside baggage claim as promised. Room was ready although we arrived 10 am. Very pretty lobby, room was small but adequate. Had large bathroom and tub. Good service, breakfast was included. Air conditioner was working fine. HAd quiet room facing a courtyard. Location is very good just around the block from the Pantheon. There is a grocery nearby. The hotel is not near the train station but near numerous bus lines. Would recommend for location and price.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would return”
Reviews.Author: jmsgso
Reviews.Content: Had a "quad" room for four nights, which was a good value for two adults and two children. Not ultra-posh, but perfectly fine and spacious, quiet, nice bathroom, air conditioning worked just fine in 90 degree, July weather. Staff was courteous and helpful, and breakfasts were very good. The location is perfect and within walking distance of just about everything and every place. Hard to fault and hard to pick another hotel given its value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Every Minute of It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at the Santa Chiara. We spent four days there and were very satified. The room was tiny, but it was beautifully decorated and clean. The bathroom was also tiny, but it was spotless. The location was excellent, we could walk to almost everything we wanted to see and do. They had all the amenities. We found the staff to be very helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Best Little Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Albergo Santa Chiara is located within walking distance of almost every sight you'd want to see. If you walk north you're two blocks from the Pantheon, and about five minutes from Trevi Fountain, and a few more minutes to the Spanish Steps. If you walk due west, you're about five minutes from Piazza Navonna. A little south of Piazza Navonna is Campo Di Fiori - also about five minutes from the hotel. If you walk due south, you're about five minutes from Capitol Hill, and a few more minutes to the Forum, Colosseum and Palatine Hill. If you walk just a couple blocks south you're at the major route to the Vatican, with a taxi stand right there for you (you could walk to the Vatican, but that's about fifteen to twenty minutes...) But the location's not all - the people taking care of us were exceptionally friendly and made every coming and going a pleasure. The concierge made a couple phone calls for us to help us with plans. The hotel offers (and don't pass it up!) pick up and drop off from the airport, for a per person fee. Even the driver was fun and punctual - waiting at the airport with our name on a sign! And at the hotel for our departure at least fifteen minutes early - we were still eating breakfast! The breakfast was amazing, and the waiters were wonderful. By the third morning our capuccinos and espressos were delivered moments after we arrived without us asking! There were meats, cheeses, pastries, coffee, a significant variety of teas, hot milk, cereal, fruit, biscotti...all included in your hotel price. Just remember, the beds anywhere in Europe (not just Rome) are much harder than American standards - but in summer the hotel has a/c and we used our heater to warm us up in winter. The shower was adjustable for height and had great pressure and hot water...You simply cannot find a better hotel in Rome - unless you choose to pay a fortune, but if you're reading this - you won't.

Reviews.Title: “Near the Pantheon, Standoffish staff”
Reviews.Author: pauillac
Reviews.Content: The nearby Pantheon and the piazza just in front of it is worth seeing -- an ancient temple embedded in a still-vibrant & bustling neighborhood, charming lanes with great little shops, a couple of Michelin one-star restaurants, & fabulous architecture. Just don't assume that you'll get a room with a window. And if you have to engage the front-desk staff for any reason, good luck. It is their place, I reminded myself, because the sense of hospitality is just not there. For example, after I paid the bill, they simply turned away without saying anything. From the Piazza Santa Chiara, the Minerva Hotel certainly seems like a more appealing place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: SummerPatti
Reviews.Content: We loved our trip to Rome. Santa Chiara was in the best location possible. The Pantheon was in our backyard and we walked to the Vatican and the Coloseum. Rome is beautiful. Santa Chiara has a nice breakfast. The beds are hard, just like everywhere else in Italy, but the staff was extremely helpful. Would stay there again.
